Our Company
Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands— everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours

. The Opportunity
Adobe is seeking talented and passionate Software Engineer across all organizations to help plan, design, develop, and test software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related computer programs and products.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

What You’ll Do

Develop high-performance, reliable, testable and maintainable code.

Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation.

Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings.

Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you.

Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication.

Additional responsibilities as needed based on specific role or team

What You Need to Succeed

Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineer, or equivalent experience required

Proficient in programming languages such as Python, Java, C++ etc.

Strong technical background with analytical and problem-solving skills

Strong knowledge in Java or JavaScript and at least one other language like Python, C#, Ruby, PHP.

Familiarity with client-side frameworks and libraries like React, Vue, Angular, jQuery.

Excellent problem solving and debugging skills, and direct experience with DevOps in a SaaS environment is a plus.

Customer focused and have real passion for quality and engineering excellence at scale.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

New York Starting Salary $95,200 - $123,700

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Job_Description:
Our Company

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Position Summary:
The Adobe Analytics platform processes 20+ billion transactions daily and delivers reporting data to customers worldwide. The Adobe Analytics team seeks a dedicated and passionate Software Engineer with top-notch technical, design, and development skills to join our Data Ingestion team in Lehi, Utah. In this role, you will collaborate closely with other engineers, developing and testing the next generation of reliable, high-performance, scalable solutions. You will have the opportunity to develop solutions handling Big Data for enterprise customers worldwide.


Design, build, and maintain high-performance, scalable solutions for customers processing Big Data.

Optimize and test existing software to enhance and improve performance, functionality, and usability.

Participate in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, unit-testing, bug fixing, and operations.

Collaborate with product management and engineering to help define and implement backend services, components, and interface requirements.

Own development for features of large, highly complex projects and apply knowledge to implement architectural and feature specs to drive customer success by delivering high-quality code.

Write complete functional specifications and documentation.

Estimate schedules, breaking tasks down to reasonable one-to-three-day tasks.

Write, test, and document well-structured code against designs that scale and perform well for customers worldwide.

Identify outside technologies and know when to use them. Make recommendations for system and process improvement. Invest time and energy in improving skills and knowledge.


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science.

Experience in Java, C++, Scala, or equivalent preferred.

Understand multi-threaded design and implementation.

Experience with Linux, GIT

Ability to quickly learn and apply complex subjects and technologies.

Must be detail-oriented and demonstrate initiative and high self-motivation. Enthusiastic, creative, and positive attitude.

Excellent interpersonal skills. Excellent English verbal and written communication skills. Highly collaborative working style.

Title: 2023 University Graduate - Software Development Engineer 1
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
We are building the next generation of work productivity tools. As a Software Engineer at Adobe Workfront, you will work with a dedicated team of engineers and product professionals to build products that turn heads, delight customers and continue to redefine the way work gets done.
We are seeing a Mid- level Full-Stack Engineer to join our team of dedicated engineers.
When you work at Adobe Workfront, you are much more than just a coder. Our teams own projects end to end - conception, architecture, implementation, experimentation, and iteration. You will have the opportunity to explore new technologies and learn from top-tier developers. If you are looking to up your game, there is no better place than Adobe!

What You'll Do

Take ownership for the design, development, testing, troubleshooting, measurement, optimization, and improvement of software across platforms

Champion application, framework, and service design efforts - optimizing for quality, testability, and scale.

Partner with cross functional experts (Product Management, Design, etc.) to determine customer focused solutions that tackle problems.

Contribute to domain expertise, leading to product improvements and industry breakthroughs

Leverage best practices, articulate ideas, and market them across team and organization.

Promote and benefit from a culture of continuous learning and growth

Interact with customers to refine requirements and identify vital modifications.
What you need to succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering (or equivalent education or work experience)

1-5 years of programming experience with recent experience in JavaScript technologies (React, Node, Angular, TypeScript, ES6)

Demonstrate knowledge of other technologies (Java, Spring, Docker, AWS, GCP)

Experience with data technologies (NoSQL, Kafka, Elasticsearch) is a plus

Experience building accessible applications that conform to WCAG 2.1 AA

Be comfortable with taking a reasonable amount of risk

Clear communication with the team and management to define and achieve goals.

Ability to pick up and master new concepts quickly and apply them

Experience researching solutions to problems and pitching your ideas to senior team members.

Anticipate customer needs to identify new ways to support them

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

Title: 2023 University Graduate - Software Development Engineer 1
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
As a member of the Engineering management team at Adobe Workfront, you will lead and mentor Software Engineers, and build highly effective Engineering teams within an Agile environment. Your primary goal will be to turn concepts into reality and ensure consistent delivery of high-quality, scalable, innovative software to the Automation Cloud platform.
As an Engineering Manager, you will work closely with Product Managers and other technical leaders to stay ahead of the curve with our products and architecture. Primarily responsible for Engineering craftsmanship and standard methodologies to drive improvements, and most importantly mentor engineers. Come join our team!

What you'll Do

Lead Agile processes across multiple teams that consistently deliver a quality product to customers

Rally your team to make and keep commitments to customers, the business, and themselves

Team up with your Product Owners and UX Designers in planning and preparing your teams’ backlog

Mentor, coach, and assist team members to be productive and efficient contributors to Workfront’s Knowledge Worker Automation Cloud

Meet to ensure their path for success is clear, and we’re instilling and exhibiting the right behaviors to ensure consistent, high-quality delivery.

Ensure the quality craftsmanship of your teams’. We’re always ensuring our code not only works as advertised but will continue to work when thousands upon thousands of people are using it at the same time.

Lead discussions with your teams about what emerging tools, technologies, and processes are coming that may impact how our organization grows and evolves.

Create proposals for the creation and modification of our processes and technology roadmaps in your designated areas.

Participate in interviews to find the next extraordinary engineer or leader at Workfront, convincing them that Workfront has the best software jobs on the planet.

What you need to succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering (or equivalent experience)

7+ years in engineering with 2+ years of recent experience leading software engineering teams, preferably with knowledge of technologies/languages in the Workfront stack (NodeJS, React, AWS, kubernetes, Gitlab, etc.).

Demonstrate a sophisticated knowledge of software engineering practices, craftsmanship, metrics, quality and testing procedures, process creation, and enablement.

Established track record of being the go-to, spearheading or injecting yourself in vital discussions to ensure you’re always in the loop and for your teams successful.

Significant experience optimizing software processes to ensure teams are always running efficiently and constantly seeking to improve.

Strong communication about the technical practices in software engineering in a way that makes sense and resonates with customers and other departments in the business.

Ability to adjust and adapt to changing situations in stride communicating effectively to achieve agreement and minimizing downstream effect on performance and morale.

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Research, develop, and deploy large-scale machine learning solutions for business
What you’ll Do
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, researchers, and product managers to implement AI/ML solutions into Adobe Experience Platform
Engage with customers to understand and anticipate how machine learning can solve their business problems

Experience with scikit-learn, pandas, ml-lib Preferred Qualifications
Proven track record of delivering business solutions or production software
Experience with Apache Spark, CosmosDB, Cassandra or similar
Familiarity with a Deep Learning framework such as TensorFlow or PyTorch

Job_Description:

The Opportunity

The Adobe Development Platform team is looking for an Engineering Manager for its Extensibility team. We have a vision to simplify the adoption and customization of Adobe products. We are innovating on our extensibility technology stack to improve developer experience and expand usage of Adobe integrations.
We work with a wide range of technologies and clouds including Node JS, Kubernetes, AWS and Azure.
We build pre-integrated toolkits and services to improve ease of use for Adobe extensibility.
We operate a high-availability custom event & FaaS platform relied on by businesses for millions of executions every single day.
We're globally distributed but remain tight-knit. The Adobe Developer Platform group is in Switzerland, India, New York, Canada, Utah, and California just to name a few.
Our product and team is in growth mode. There are plenty of challenges to overcome, decisions to be made, and new development to do. Some of the technologies we build on:
Linux, Docker, Kubernetes
OpenWhisk, Akka, React, Nginx, Envoy
NodeJS, Java, Python, Go


Lead and support a strong engineering team that will develop and maintain highly scalable, reliable services and applications.
Partner with Product Management, DevOps, and other key collaborators to create and implement the product roadmap.
Guide and empower the development team on decisions for features, technology, architecture, designs, time & budget estimates, and test strategies.
Mentor a diverse team of engineering talent.
Partner with other teams across Adobe to collaborate on interdependent technologies.


Excellent and effective communication skills; on our geographically distributed team, sometimes it takes extra effort to connect.
Experience leading software development teams
Experience working with and operating high-availability cloud native systems
Experience working in multi-functional environment and building partnerships with key teams
Experience with pragmatic application of Agile methodologies.
B.S. or above degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent experience.
Knowledge of cloud and container technologies including Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS or Azure is a plus.

Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
This position is for a key contributor to craft the next generation of services for Adobe’s Experience Platform Identity Services - a foundational component & unique differentiator for Adobe Digital Experience. Identity Services builds Identity Graph that links identities across devices and channels, to create a holistic consumer profile for marketing & analytics.
Identity Services processes billions of online events and CRM records each day to build its Identity Graphs. This is a once is a lifetime opportunity for engineers to solve exciting challenges of scale and build core services that are used by all Adobe Digital Experience solutions. As part of building these services, you will work with an exceptionally hardworking and collaborative team, tackle big data challenges using the latest technologies, design innovative algorithmic solutions and build highly scalable, low latency services.
What you'll Do
Build high-performance and fault-tolerant systems for data processing at scale.
Design new features by partnering with Product Management.
Participate in architecture, design and code reviews
Investigate problem areas; coordinate with other developers on resolution
Document and demonstrate solutions by developing design documentation, code comments, presentations and through code execution.
What you need to succeed
BS in Computer Science or equivalent
3+ years of experience
Strong grasp of Computer Science fundamentals specifically - algorithms and data structures
Experience developing in Java or Scala
Understanding of the Java memory model
Experience writing unit test cases using mocking frameworks such as JMockit
Desire to learn new technologies
Strong communication skills

Title: 2023 University Graduate - Software Development Engineer 1
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Adobe Systems, Inc., the industry leader digital creative and document solutions, is accepting applications for a seasoned software engineer to join the AdobeSign team. One of our most exciting and technologically advanced solutions, AdobeSign, is seeking highly qualified individuals who are eager to contribute to products that create highly valuable solutions for our customers. AdobeSign service is the fastest, and easiest way to get digital contracts signed, tracked and filed.
As an AdobeSign team member, you will be tasked with building products and features that will contribute to the success and functionality of our product for our customers. Understanding and being able to implement machine learning to problem-solve in our agile software development workflow is integral to producing scalable and high-quality solutions. Additionally, being able to identify technology challenges and deficiencies with a new perspective will make your time on our team a mutually valuable experience.
At Adobe, we value integrity, innovation and diversity. Since our founding in 1982, these values have remained consistent. We know that we are more than the sum of our parts. Every one of our employees is valued for their skill and talent, and appreciated for their deep passion and commitment to our organization, as well as the service we provide to our customers. Your knowledge and experience is just as valuable. As a company we are also committed to being environmentally and socially responsible. Our digital solutions are saving time, reducing waste, and creating a sustained positive environmental impact. Your contributions at Adobe have the chance to change the world through shifts to digital workflows!
We hope that you see yourself as the right person to fill this intern position. We are excited for you to apply. In addition to the brief description above, additional preferred skills and possible responsibilities are listed below.


Build tools and tests that help create customer experiences that delight our customers.
Identifying problems where ML can be used to reduce manual processes associated with Quality engineering.
Pro-actively identify and resolve resource dependencies.
Set priorities for parallel projects.
Identify project risks and be able to provide alternatives for reducing risk.


BS with 4 years or MS in computer science with 2 years of Industry experience

Title: 2023 University Graduate - Software Development Engineer 1
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Challenge
The Adobe Document Cloud Data Science team is looking for Machine Learning Engineers who can apply AI/ML techniques and help us build solutions that will drive the success of our Document Cloud business. Partnering with the business units, you will be working on the development of various data science models that address challenging business problems including acquisition, engagement, conversion and retention. You will have the opportunity to exercise creativity in problem solving by delivering inventive new solutions within our data ecosystem. We invite you to join a team of passionate engineers to elevate our customer experiences to the next level.
What you’ll do

Develop and implement scalable and efficient models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems through using sophisticated statistical modeling, machine learning techniques.

Conceptualize, build, and maintain integrated machine learning systems that continuously operate in production while maintaining model baselines, addressing data and model drift, and continuous improvement

Solve challenging Data Science problems such as online learning, reinforcement learning etc. when solving business problems in digital marketing.

Gather, synthesize and interpret disparate quantitative information sources, develop meaningful insights and clearly disseminating to key partners

Collaborate with product marketing, product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features.

Create a winning culture built on collaboration and shared accomplishments- have fun along the way!

What you need to succeed

Deep understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, deep learning and analytics concepts, and a track record of solving problems with these methods.

A strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large data sets for analytical purposes using SQL-like languages (Hive/Hadoop experience preferred)

Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, R

Curiosity in building and maintaining high-scale, production-ready machine learning systems using rigorous engineering principles

Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability.

PhD or MS degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Electrical Engineering, Operations Research, Econometrics, or other related fields.

Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a great teammate.

Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity

We seek a hardworking Experienced Software Engineer for the Customer Engineering Team (CET) to help ensure the best experience for our biggest customers. CET is an enterprise skunkworks and a flex engineering swat team that interacts directly with the largest technology companies in the world while building the highest scale features. We are developing scaling and performance solutions to better meet our service demands. This work requires multi-team collaboration, solution development, migration planning, and scheduling. We present solutions, proposals, and explanations with varying amounts of technical detail depending on the audience. We are a team of highly skilled engineers working with Java/Scala and renovating some legacy PHP/MySQL with an emphasis on building out new robust services and components in several stacks: Cloud database (Aurora), JavaScript, Java, serverless, and streaming technologies. Building new stuff using Git and more modern CI/CD pipelines to bolster or replace components of our legacy systems. The majority of the work currently centers around Adobe's Marketo product line.

This is a highly interactive position. You will be dealing with internal stakeholders, different component owners, and customers directly and will need to maintain those relationships. Occasional travel will occur when appropriate.

Currently, this is a work-from-home position until we move to a hybrid in-office model as Adobe forms its future work vision. The core team is in Portland, OR while other associated teams are in Seattle, WA, and San Jose, CA.

We assist other component owners in delivering high-quality features to our customers. Join our high-performance team that demands the highest quality experiences!

Qualities Sought
Completion of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent experience. A career that includes developing and maintaining Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) software for over 8 years in collaborative development teams. Desire to quickly become proficient with the specific tooling or languages we are using if you aren't as familiar with our toolsets.


Cloud database and service stacks, particularly AWS
Performance testing, modern dev-ops, cloud migration techniques
Functional programming paradigms, immutable data structures
Capacity planning, on-prem to cloud transitioning
PHP, Java or JavaScript stacks
Various data stores, how to model them, get data in and out of them
Virtualization, containers, orchestration technologies
UI toolkits

Is this you?
We’re looking for someone who enjoys and excels at building high-performance solutions, troubleshooting sophisticated and complicated software problems, and working with others to do so. Someone who prefers developing through agile project management systems and modern quality assurance approaches. A team member who communicates well with others in person, in video, and in writing.

Title: 2023 University Graduate - Software Development Engineer 1
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) enables businesses to deliver the right experience at the right time to their customers. The Segmentation Service is one of the key AEP services, providing the ability to define customer segments and generate target audiences based on real-time customer profiles. Customer segment definitions are sophisticated queries over profile and event data capturing specific attributes or behaviors shared by a subset of users. With the need to perform trillions of audience segment evaluations per day, scalability and efficiency are paramount in segment evaluation. This is a great opportunity for engineers to solve extremely interesting challenges of scale and build core services that are used by all Adobe Digital Experience solutions. As part of building these services, you will work with an exceptionally talented and collaborative team, tackle large scale data management and complex query evaluation challenges, design & implement innovative algorithms and build highly performant services.

What you'll Do
Collaborate with a team of engineers & product managers in building a high-performance segmentation engine.
Develop and implement techniques for large scale distributed data management across data lake and warehouse style environments
Develop and implement query translation algorithms to generate efficient SQL queries from segment definitions
Explore tradeoffs across alternate schema layouts and query translation optimizations driven by workload and application characteristics
Deploy production services and iteratively improve them based on customer feedback
Follow Agile methodologies using industry leading CI/CD pipelines
Participate in architecture, design & code reviews
What you need to succeed
B.S. in Computer Science or a related field is required
M.S. in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent practical experience is preferred
Practical experience at scale in distributed systems or databases
Knowledge and experience in data lakes, data warehouses or Spark is preferred
Knowledge and experience in query compilation and optimization techniques is a plus
Strong programming skills with extensive experience in Java or Scala
Excellent communication skills
Experience collaborating across teams is preferred
Adaptable to evolving priorities, accepting challenges outside one's comfort zone, learning new technologies, and delivering viable solutions within defined time boundaries.
Ability to think through solutions from a short term and long-term lens in an iterative development cycle.

We are growing our team that provides successful and timely technical support to Adobe Digital Media customers.
Members of this team will be expected to rapidly troubleshoot issues, diagnose and replicate problems, evaluate resolution options and develop reliable solutions in a technical support role.
Our team members take care of the customer by maintaining ownership, offering expert advice and resolving complex technical problems. Specifically, the role encompasses inbound issue reception, triage and analysis, technical issue diagnosis and resolution identification; documentation, tracking and recording of all issues and interactions. We partner with internal Adobe teams (Sales, Engineering, Customer Success, Professional Services and others) to address complex issues for which no immediate solution is available.
What you'll do
Working from our office in Lehi, you will support enterprise-level Adobe customers using Creative Cloud and other products through phone, web portals, email and chat
As a top tier support resource, utilize advanced troubleshooting skills and root cause analysis to facilitate timely resolution of customer issues, often under high-pressure and escalated situations
Own issues from initial contact through resolution, raising critical support issues from customers to the appropriate internal channel
Assist customers and partners in configuring and deploying enterprise software solutions using a variety of industry-standard deployment methodologies
Research, replicate and report bugs and work with the Quality Engineering, Engineering, and Product Management teams to prioritize urgent and top issues for resolution
Work closely with the Product and Engineering teams to share customer insights and enhance our product based on customer experience and needs
Effectively utilize support/diagnostic tools, case management systems, use/update knowledge base articles, and communicate effectively through case documentation
As required, participate in off-hours support activities including a rotational on-call schedule
Achieve performance targets including case status updates, resolution time, open case aging, first contact resolution rate, case quality and customer satisfaction
What you need to succeed
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent experience.
3-5 years of experience in a technical support or engineering position
Strong structured problem resolution skills
Highly technology literate, knowledge of complex network, browser and software systems, with excellent and proven knowledge applicable to Adobe’s products and technologies such as our design or imaging applications
Detailed knowledge of Windows, Windows Server and Mac operating systems including Microsoft Installer Technologies and deployment methods
Technical knowledge of virtualization technologies and their use, networks and permissions, digital certifications and XML schemas
Deep understanding of Identity and Access Management, Single Sign-On, SAML, enterprise software deployment technologies
Excellent customer presence and exceptional verbal and written communication skills with an ability to influence others and gain acceptance for ideas, sometimes in sensitive situations
Able to thrive in a fast-paced, matrix-managed, distributed environment, performing effectively on multiple priorities, while providing timely resolutions in a high-pressure environment

source code control, unit testing, in-code documentation and automated build environments.

Title: 2023 University Graduate - Software Development Engineer 1
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity:
We’re looking for an engineer that loves learning technology and uses it to deliver sustainable business solutions. Our focus is helping engineering teams know how their systems are performing so they can find problems before customers do. We believe in automating whenever possible, pull requests, infrastructure as code, and failing fast. We are also advocates for standard methodologies, and regularly train internal teams on how they can use our technologies. This team member will build and maintain solutions for getting insights on infrastructure and services supporting applications, with a focus on logs, metrics, and application traces that improve observability. We think about the problem end-to-end: automation of data collection from common data sources, storing data efficiently in performance managing, and monitoring tools.

Are you comfortable running production environments *AND* writing code?

Do you have an intimate understanding of the operational challenges of running services at scale?

Tackle challenges through software engineering instead of sustained human toil?

Are you keen to explore new technologies and looking to help build a path not-yet-traveled?

Do you combine the above experiences and talent with strong communication skills, a customer-centric demeanor, and a will to “get stuff done” - all while learning and having fun?


Collaborate with operations & engineering teams, application developers, management and infrastructure teams to assess near- and long-term monitoring needs.

Keep an eye on emerging observability tools, trends and methodologies, and continuously enhance our existing systems and processes.

Assist with driving observability standards to improve the consumer experience of meaningful applications, services, and business processes with a strong focus on the end-to-end journey.

Assist in scheduling and hosting regular tool training sessions to better enable adoption and standardize methodologies.

Work with multiple teams to design, deploy, and support large scale clustered software platforms in multiple datacenters and public clouds around the world

Deliver highly secure solutions within comprehensive compliance regulations.

Integrate diverse technologies in multiple environments to provide monitoring, alerting, and reporting of performance and costs

Work with third-party hardware and software vendors to recommend solutions and drive performance and cost efficiency


Proven track record with Linux, including large scale OS deployment and automation

Experience in public cloud infrastructure (AWS preferred)

Experience in Python/Go

Experience building and using orchestration, automation and configuration management solutions (Terraform/Kubernetes preferred)

Experience deploying a modern monitoring stack (Prometheus/Grafana preferred)

Previous experience defining, creating, and supporting monitoring dashboards

Working across departments popularizing observability expertise and standards

Possess practical knowledge of various aspects of distributed service design, including messaging protocols, caching strategies and autonomous software design practices.

Experience with monitoring and observability solutions and methodologies including server and network performance, hardware, web synthetics, and application performance monitoring a plus.

Eager to learn, able to take guidance, and able to understand that there is always more to learn

Frameio-All1

Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City.
New York Starting Salary $154,000 - $200,000

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Opportunity

Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) enables businesses to deliver the right experience at the right time to their customers. The Segmentation Service is one of the key AEP services, providing the ability to define customer segments and generate target audiences based on real-time customer profiles. Customer segment definitions are sophisticated queries over profile and event data capturing specific attributes or behaviors shared by a subset of users. With the need to perform trillions of audience segment evaluations per day, scalability and efficiency are paramount in segment evaluation. This is a great opportunity for engineers to solve extremely interesting challenges of scale and build core services that are used by all Adobe Digital Experience solutions. As part of building these services, you will work with an exceptionally talented and collaborative team, tackle complex query evaluation challenges, design & implement innovative algorithms and build highly performant services.

Job_Description:

About Cloud Operations
Adobe Cloud Operations supports a broad range of Adobe’s software product portfolio in the areas of design, delivery, and operation. We’re a distributed team of over 300 hard-working people who assist Development and Product Management teams to balance scope, quality, and time to market for our industry leading SaaS solutions.
About the Role
The Security Services team within Cloud Operations provides a suite of security tooling solutions that enable product development teams to get their work done. We embed security controls into our solutions so that our product teams can focus on improving features for Adobe’s global customer base. We are seeking a driven security DevOps engineer who can assist with our Secrets Management and Privileged Access Control teams. This position demands broad understanding and solid performance. Expected responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to:
Providing HashiCorp Vault services to the enterprise. Understanding Vault capabilities, use cases, and the accurate use of Vault within product deployment and runtime.
Understanding user access (human to machine) both on-premises and cloud resources.
Experience delivering highly secure and efficient solutions with comprehensive compliance frameworks including: FedRAMP, SOC2, ISO27001, HIPAA, PCI, and others.
Familiarity with observability, monitoring, and alerting systems including Splunk, Grafana, and PagerDuty.
Resolve system outages or performance impact and communicate findings for ongoing improvement.
Work with third-party vendors to recommend solutions and drive performance and cost efficiency.
Participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation
The successful candidate with have proven experience or capability in the following areas:
Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience
Deep experience with Linux, including large scale OS deployment and automation
3-5+ years of team lead or mentoring capabilities
Experience in public cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience operating secrets management tools (HashiCorp Vault, Azure Key Vault, AWS KMS)
Experience using orchestration, automation, and configuration management solutions (Jenkins/Terraform/SaltStack/Rundeck )
Experience with log analytics tooling (Splunk preferred))
Experience with programming or scripting (Python, Go, Bash, PowerShell)
Ability to recommend, design, build, and support complicated solutions at scale
Understanding of TCP/IP networking protocols and related technologies
Knowledge of software version control systems and release management (Git preferred)
Excellent written and verbal communication
About our Ideal Candidate
Passionate about designing and supporting complex IT systems while also being able to run day-to-day infrastructure operations. We want someone who does not prefer one tool, but rather looks for the right tool for the job
Mentorship experience and the desire to lead a team of engineers to the next level
Experience with FedRAMP environments and the ATO approval process
Analytical with the ability to fix complex system problems, to assess system performance problems, and can resolve situations looking for all the options and turning over every rock to find the best solution
Eager to learn, able to take guidance, and able to understand that there is always more to learn
Ability to work hard as a member of a small team that is asked to do a lot, while always remaining focused on customer success
Can manage time properly such that commitments are communicated and then met

source code control, unit testing, in-code documentation and automated build environments.

Title: Cloud Software Engineer - Data Science & Analytics
Cloud Software Engineer - Data Science & Analytics
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity

We believe AI will revolutionize the next generation of creative tools, automating repetitive tasks while leaving creative agency with the user. This is your opportunity to join a world-class team of researchers, engineers, and software developers who are inventing the next generation of creative tools powered by machine learning. In this role you will work with a team at Adobe Research that incubates new product experiences at the intersection of ML, interaction, and video. You will use your versatile engineering skills and experience building interactive ML systems to code, test, maintain, and improve prototype and product releases.


Write high-quality code with a team across the stack of web-based creative tools. We use TypeScript, React, and Node.js for full-stack web development, and Python for backend ML development.

Write code across various stages of research development, from early prototyping and exploration (quick hypothesis testing) to building product releases (high-quality, efficient, robust code).

Evaluate and integrate novel ML algorithms with an emphasis on the user experience. You will consider usability, explainability, robustness, and ML fairness.

Carefully evaluate ML models. This may involve collecting datasets by designing tasks and guidelines for human judgment jobs to annotate media.

Carefully document all experiments, failure cases, and outcomes.

Build the next generation of creative tools with a multi-disciplinary team of extraordinary engineers and researchers. This is a “best of both worlds” opportunity where you’ll have the flexibility, scope, and personal impact of joining a startup, but also the deep resources, cool perks, and global launch stage that only an industry leader like Adobe can offer.


A PhD in Computer Science or related field with a focus at the intersection of human-computer interaction and ML or computer vision.

Interest and experience with creative tools.

A strong record of solving challenging user problems demonstrated in scientific publications or other research output.

Experience with both TypeScript and Python. A passion for high-quality software engineering.

Experience working with teams and code review.

Hand-on experience collecting and labeling datasets using human raters.

Understanding of issues around ground truth and training/evaluation data for ML, including human judgment, A/B testing, and ML fairness.

Ability to effectively and convincingly communicate ideas and objectives to audiences of all levels.

The Opportunity

Frame.io, an Adobe Company, is changing the future of how videos are made by helping over 1 million creative professionals seamlessly collaborate from all over the world.

Frame.io is a detail-oriented, product-led company that is constantly pushing the envelope on design and performance. We're looking for a frontend developer to work with our marketing team to build better first impressions — on our marketing site, blog, and project-based microsites. This role is for you if you’re obsessed with the latest techniques in web design and development, and have an eye for differentiating between design fads and worthwhile trends. When you stumble on a cool website, you immediately open the inspector. You may geek out on tech, but you also have a strong design sensibility. No detail escapes you.

Our design, marketing, and growth teams use a creative, data-driven, and iterative approach to craft experiences worthy of the customers we serve. We move quickly and have bold ideas, but you’ll work side by side with world-class talent to deliver the best work of your career.

What you'll Do

Craft and optimize our marketing websites, including https://frame.io and https://blog.frame.io

Develop new projects with our marketing and growth teams to help more people discover and adopt Frame.io

Optimize site design and performance across a variety of devices.

Manage the implementation of our on-site marketing automation tools, like Segment, Intercom, Drift, and Sumo

Work closely with our product, design, and analytics teams to push the envelope on elegance and performance

What you need to succeed

You're a front-end developer highly proficient in HTML5, CSS, and Javascript, who is comfortable, and even passionate about, working without constraints

You've built a number of websites from concept to completion

You are proficient in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

You're up-to-date with the latest web technologies and libraries (React, etc.)

You have an eye for interaction, motion, and graphic design

You have a strong working knowledge of responsive web design and cross-platform compatible coding techniques and troubleshooting

You have experience with code driven animations and transitions (GSAP, Framer Motion or similar)

Experience with graphics programming or shading languages (Three.JS, PIXI.js, WebGL) a plus!

4+ years of applicable experience

Bachelors / Graduate Degree or applicable experience

Title: Cloud Software Engineer - Data Science & Analytics
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
Frame.io, an Adobe Company, is changing the future of how videos are made by helping over 1 million creative professionals seamlessly collaborate from all over the world.
Engineers at Frame.io are creative, technical people making beautiful and powerful tools to enable other creative, technical people to do their best work—Frame.io is the thread that runs through the entire video post-production process. The product and engineering team at Frame.io bases our process on five principles:

We always come back to the problem to solve.

We explore solutions at the right level of detail.

We give full responsibility to designers and engineers during their phases of a project.

We ship often to ensure we deliver value to customers often.
We are looking for a senior back-end engineer who can turn ideas into beautifully written code that other people—or you, six months into the future—will find easy to comprehend and modify. You will:

Model a rich and expansive domain. You’ll design and implement data models for every facet of the post-production domain, as well as powerful systems to keep the Frame.io application efficient and stable.

Contribute to a mature (but not too crufty!) Elixir application. Frame.io is home to one of the largest Elixir applications in the world, and senior engineers here have the opportunity to design highly concurrent, fault-tolerant systems.

Own the implementation of great features. You’ll work directly with designers, client engineers and product owners to bring new features to life. You’ll provide guidance and input into the process of building and deploying their vision, as well as writing the code that makes it real.

Guide and mentor your fellow engineers. You’ll be an authority on best practices for the engineering team, as well as an important leader for other engineers in the organization - back-end and otherwise.
Our team is highly productive and committed to mutual support, collaboration and knowledge-sharing. We are dedicated to a work environment where we can all grow and learn, and combine this commitment with a dedication to quality engineering and sound, informed technical decisions. We understand that the best code is the code that moves our business forward, and we make every decision about the back-end in the context of the product that everybody at Frame.io is building together. What you'll Do

Write solid and scalable code.

Doing regular code reviews.

Building new features and services in Elixir.

Providing technical leadership to junior engineers. What you need to succeed

Extensive, solid experience in designing and developing multiple large-scale Web application back-ends.

Experience in Elixir or a comparable functional programming language.

Experience in MySQL or PostgreSQL outside of an ORM, including the ability to design SQL queries for performance and efficiency.

Familiarity with common API and services design best practices.

Deep experience in overall system design and implementation—how they scale, how they should fit together, and how they’re likely to break.

Experience migrating legacy components with little to no downtime.

Ability to analyze and solve difficult problems across the back-end.

Ensuring quality around web-based user interfaces and cloud services.
Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, automation, code review, manual testing, bug fixing, and test plan documentation.

Review each other’s work and hold team members accountable for high code quality standards.

Impact and grow. You’ll be involved in significant decisions about how we build and grow Acrobat Web, and have a strong say in what we build next.
Lead and engage your peers, mentor junior team members, build partnerships with key partners across the matrix to achieve shared objectives.
Write readable, performant, bug-free code.
Look for ways to continually improve the product and process.
Work effectively in a dynamic and ever-evolving environment. What is needed to succeed:

5 +years of professional software product/service development experience.

Demonstrable experience collaborating across local and remote teams to build web apps at scale
Experience writing unit and functional tests and test frameworks, such as Jasmine, Mocha, and Jest.
Shown ability to develop robust, efficient, high-quality code.

Engineering at Frame.io is about more than just writing code - it's crafting products that inspire creativity and allow our users to do great work. We care deeply about how our products are built, how they look, how they feel, and how they function.
We're looking for an experienced frontend engineer to join our growing engineering team and help build our flagship web app. Together with your cross-functional product squad, you'll own a significant area of our product and ship revolutionary new features to our platform.

Success in this role is shipping, maintaining and iterating on a best-in-class web app that enables our customers to do their best work.

Build our flagship web product by creating fluid interfaces that perform at massive scale

Shape, prototype, demo and ship new features with members on your squad from design, product, user insights, QA, backend as well as other frontend engineers

Receive and offer technical feedback through pair programming and code reviews

Promote engineering excellence with a focus on performance, scalability, privacy, and security

Participate in our On Call and Triage rotation to keep our service running smoothly for our customers

Receive close guidance and mentorship from our engineering managers and leads What you need to succeed

A love of product design, fluid interfaces, and using exceptional products

Experience building pixel-perfect, robust, performant and accessible user interfaces on the web

Experience implementing complex UI with CSS, animation, orchestration and responsiveness

JavaScript/TypeScript fluency using a framework like React (preferred)

Experience working with sophisticated application state, e.g. Apollo Client, Redux, MobX or similar

A dedication to learning and sharing ideas with your fellow engineers

Mastery of breaking down, discussing, and communicating abstract technical concepts

GraphQL experience is a plus

We work in small, agile teams with considerable autonomy, and we value engineers with technical competence, creativity, flexibility, strong customer focus and an eagerness for learning and collaboration. By helping our customers create, handle and share documents, we improve Adobe's ability to empower creative people, business professionals and marketing specialists to be successful. This is an opportunity to create a system that ultimately benefits millions of Adobe customers every day.

We are looking for a Staff Computer Scientist to join the core Acrobat Web team. The team is a dynamic Agile software development team focused on producing scalable and high-quality enterprise solutions. As an Acrobat Web engineer, you will enjoy working on both front-end and back-end solutions.

Building great products Acrobat Web
The below links provide more info on some areas worked upon by the team and opportunities for you to be part of this innovative team. Take a look …
Innovating thru Frictionless PDF Verbs
Partnering with Google on .new verbs
Rethink editing with Microsoft 365 in Acrobat online
Team Responsibilities

Continuous improvement is the goal.

Participate in story mapping, backlog grooming, daily stand-ups, retrospectives, and sprint reviews on a two-week cadence.

Review each other’s work and hold team members accountable for high code quality standards.

Deliver regular increments of potentially shippable functionality on time with high quality.
The Role

Have meaningful ownership. You’ll be involved in important decisions about how we build and grow Acrobat Web and have a strong say in what we build next.

Be a leader. Engage your peers, mentor junior team members, build partnerships with key partners across the matrix to achieve shared objectives.

Write readable, performant, bug-free code.

Look for ways to continually improve the product and process.

Work effectively in a dynamic and ever-evolving environment.
What is needed to succeed

BS/MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent with strong computer science fundamentals

Real passion for new tools and technologies

10+ years of full-stack Web Development

JavaScript, React, HTML, CSS, ES6, WebAssembly, JavaScript frameworks

Hands on experience in working in a client-server architecture

Extensive experience with CI/CD

Experience with SEO

Experience with Java/Spring/RESTful development

PDF experience is a plus

Title: Cloud Software Engineer - Data Science & Analytics
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
Frame.io, an Adobe Company, is changing the future of how videos are made by helping over 1 million creative professionals seamlessly collaborate from all over the world.

We are looking for a highly motivated, adaptable and talented Senior Application Security Engineer who is expert in building/breaking/educating. Your work will directly impact the experience of our highly passionate creator community. We are looking for natural innovators who strive to continuously improve and learn.
What you'll Do
Work independently with developers, product owners, and other domains to ensure secure design, development, and implementation of applications
Be the security expert and effectively communicate information to technical and non-technical team members
Recognize security needs and recommend suitable technologies and controls
Design and build security tools integrated with the CICD pipeline
Lean in to any challenge, even if not directly relevant to core competencies
Actively provide technical leadership to more junior members of the security team
Respond to security alerts What you need to succeed
5-7 years of relevant experience
A strong foundation in and an in-depth technical knowledge of application security, particularly web application and iOS security
Experience threat modeling system designs and implementation—how they scale, how they should fit together, and how they’re likely to break
Ability to participate in design reviews and conduct code reviews with an eye for security vulnerabilities
Expertise in application security related concepts, such as authentication, authorization, data integrity, session management, access controls, and input/output handling
Experience in triaging findings from security tools, bug bounty programs, and the external research community
Proficient in one or more programming languages (some examples include Elixir, Node.js, Python, Go)
Ability to analyze and solve complex problems
Security experience in a SaaS product is a plus

Title: Cloud Software Engineer - Data Science & Analytics
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity

Frame.io, an Adobe Company, is changing the future of how videos are made by helping over 2 million creative professionals seamlessly collaborate from all over the world.

Engineering at Frame.io is about more than just writing code - it's crafting products that inspire creativity and allow our users to do great work. We care deeply about how our products are built, how they look, feel, function, and how they impact the filmmaking community.

We're looking for a full stack engineer to join our Camera to Cloud (C2C) engineering team! Our best-in-class tech stack, designers, and engineering team needs someone like you to help us go above and beyond traditional web applications.

The C2C team is actively redefining the art of filmmaking. Our product relies on innovation, so we work in equally innovative ways. We believe that our team is more powerful by being a team of full stack engineers. Our versatility allows us to tackle any challenge because we embody the principle of growing, not just relying on skills we already have.

Engineering, Internal Production, and Production Technology, which cover all aspects of ideating, designing, stress-testing, and deploying our next-gen products. It’s how we ensure that our product makes the lives of video creators easier, through every phase of production and post.

We have access to a full-blown video production team of industry professionals, and their footage isn’t just good, it's Hollywood quality. They are here to help show you, as an engineer, about what they do and what problems they need to solve — and they're the first ones to test a PoC, beta, or any early release before customers get their hands on it. Then, when it comes time to release a feature you built, you get to work directly with the team who is going to help introduce this technology to the world! What you'll Do
We’ve designed our tech stack to provide the best possible developer experience so you can focus on solving the right challenges; we obsess over building software for our creators with the best performance, scalability, privacy, and security. In this role you will:
Work in a next-generation technology stack by building our flagship web product
On the frontend, you’ll be using React, Next.js, Apollo Client, Typescript, GraphQL Codegen, Jest, Storybook, Styled Components, and Framer Motion. You will get to own development of complex features, performance profile components, design beautiful animations, or PoC a new web API, just depends on the day.
On the backend, you'll write mostly Elixir with a bit of Python and Golang. We are a cloud based tool so you might be asked to dig into offerings of our cloud service providers, spin up a Kubernetes cluster, write system diagrams or anything in between.
Shape, prototype, demo, and ship new features with members on your squad from design, product, user insights, QA, backend, as well as other frontend engineers
Receive and offer technical feedback through pair programming and code reviews
Participate in our On-Call and Triage rotation to keep our service running smoothly for our customers What you need to succeed
A creative spirit, who loves to engineer
The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
A self-starter, who can take a project from inception to delivery
A love of product design, fluid interfaces, and using exceptional products
JavaScript/TypeScript fluency using a framework like React (preferred)
Backend language fluency with common API and service design methodologies (Functional programming is a bonus)
Experience in applying different database technologies fluency like Postgres or Redis
A dedication to learning and sharing ideas with your fellow engineers
Mastery of breaking down, discussing, and communicating abstract technical concepts
GraphQL experience is a plus

Title: Sr Experience Designer, Adobe Sign AI/ML
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The opportunity
Adobe Design is seeking a Senior Experience Designer to join our Document Cloud design team to build next-generation experiences for Adobe Sign using powerful advancements in artificial intelligence and machine learning.
We are looking for a curious, articulate, and future-oriented designer to push the boundaries of design, technology, and user experience. Someone who is enthusiastic about the application of AI/ML to help people read and comprehend better, and businesses streamline workflows and unlock content to make better decisions. This is an opportunity to help craft the future of documents and agreements.
What you'll do
Work with a multidisciplinary team to conceptualize and craft solutions to bring AI/ML powered experiences that delight and inspire users
Keep up with the constantly evolving field of design for AI/ML, consistently bringing new ideas to the team.
Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions about how the product looks, feels, and behaves.
Lead the end-to-end product development process, partnering closely with cross-functional teams, such as product and engineering, to ship quality experiences on time.
Define design strategy and craft visions for products and experiences.
Be an advocate for the user. Use customer feedback and data analytics to focus on key problems to tackle for users.

At least 5 years of experience in product/UX design with a proven track record of great designs and strategy that meet user needs, product requirements, and business objectives.

Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication, and storytelling skills.
Desire to challenge yourself, learn new skills, and share knowledge.
College degree in HCI or design related field, with an emphasis on user experience, interaction design, or visual design.
How to apply
To be considered for this role please submit a resume and portfolio with examples of process and evolution of work.
About Adobe Design
Adobe Design builds tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers, content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud.

Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Passionate about mobile photography and AI? This is your opportunity to work with a team that will be changing the camera industry.

Adobe's EPG (Emerging Product Group) is seeking a senior Mobile Developer to join our team in San Jose, California. You will part of the core team that is exploring next-generation product opportunities centered around the concept of a universal camera app, and empowered by machine learning, computer vision, and computational photography. The effort will begin as part of our Photoshop Camera app, growing its photographic collection capabilities in new directions. If successful it will grow to become a technology platform for other Adobe products, with the opportunity for broad impact.

If you are passionate about mobile photography and AI this is your opportunity to work with a truly great team on some really exciting projects.

What you’ll do
Our team works like a startup inside Adobe, making this is a unique “best of both worlds” opportunity. If you’d love the flexibility and personal impact of joining an exciting startup but also dream of having the deep resources, cool perks and global launch stage that only an industry leader like Adobe can offer, this is where you belong.
You’ll have strong input on the direction of this new product category while working directly with the experienced startup entrepreneurs leading this project.
You’ll lead the iOS projects to guide a high performing team.
Develop, implement, test, deploy, and support our mobile app on iOS and/or Android.
Understanding of core CS including data structures, algorithms and concurrent programming
Collaborate with our designers, product managers, researchers and visual effects engineers.
Make an impact while building a rewarding career at a new growing division within Adobe

What you need to succeed
5+ years of industrial experience in developing large applications.
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent.
3+ years iOS development experience and Android development experience as a plus.
Proficient in Objective-C, Xcode, C, and C++, are required and Android Studio is a plus
Proficient in Swift is a plus
Knowledge of GPU and Image/Video Processing, and experience in iOS and/or Android camera capture pipeline as a plus.

Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Does this sound like you?
We're looking for the ultimate technical program leader.
You believe successful leadership across a sea of teams requires a thorough understanding of how the constituent systems work together. Engineers and architects enjoy engaging with you because you "get it."
You instinctively understand where others are coming from and use that perspective to unblock misunderstandings. You build bridges.
You are a consummate diplomat. You always take time to craft your words. You excel at working across a vast array of teams and cultures around the globe. Your ability to influence executives and gain their trust in the midst of vague or high-pressure situations is outstanding.
You have an extraordinary internal drive and spark – others are continually in awe of how much you accomplish.
You bring genuine enthusiasm and positive energy to programs. Your presence makes your peers feel the finish line is just a little closer.
It's not about you, it's about the team and the program.
What you'll do
Own some of the most visible, strategic, and intricate programs inside of Adobe.
Partner with Product Management, Engineering, Design, Architecture, and executives to define success, and then develop a plan to reach that vision. You keep the end in mind.
Assess the goals, team dynamic, and technical plan of the programs you lead.
Continually listen to team members to determine the true state and maturity of the program, and then encourage, protect, prod, or cajole as needed.
Lean in to keep the program moving forward even when others hang back. Continually look for ways to apply your exceptional talents, even if it is outside your formal job description.
Regularly summarize and communicate progress to executives.
What you'll get
You'll report to a manager who is invested in you as a person and who loves to mentor. We want you to grow and thrive. After a year people should be asking for you by name!

At Adobe people actually take vacation. We have two shutdowns every year – no overflowing inbox upon your return. Adobe also provides a paid sabbatical every 5 years.
What you need to succeed
You're always teachable and eager to adapt. You may have climbed similar mountains, but you've never climbed this mountain.
Past experience in technical roles or a computer science related education is required.
Extraordinary follow through – things do not fall through the cracks.
Your emails are seen as models of clarity. Keeping your inbox in order is a given.
7+ years of technical program management experience. Past experience coordinating and leading teams that included more than 40 software engineers.

Title: Senior Engineering Program Manager
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
ADBE) achieved record annual revenue of $15.79 billion in fiscal year 2021, which represents 23 percent year-over-year growth.
The company completed ~$10B in strategic & transformative acquisitions since 2018 including Marketo (B2B Marketing Automation), Magento (Commerce), Workfront (Marketing Workflow Management), Frame.io (Video Collaboration), ContentCal (Social Media Workflow & Calendaring), Abstract Notebooks (Collaboration) and Brio (3D&AR for ecommerce). Adobe makes bold acquisitions based on strategic conviction like the creation of the Experience Cloud with Omniture and Day Software.
Adobe’s recent Direct Investments (Corporate Venture) include Skillshare (Learning Platform), LucidLink (Video Storage), Vidmob (Creative Analytics), Truepic (Content Authenticity), and Tiled (Interactive Content). This continues Adobe rich history of making 'around the corner' investments that can lead to strategic exits like Allegorithmic.

What you’ll do
The program manager will support the business operations of CDMA by running cadences across business, talent, portfolio company / acquired company reviews for VP, Corp Dev, Executive Team and Board of Directors. This includes supporting the creation and maintenance of annual, integrated planning calendar, clear milestones, templates, and deliverables.

This individual will also support Corp Dev & Adobe’s corporate reputation by coordinating external “outside-in” learning sessions with industry leaders and portfolio companies. This may include understanding the cadence of key industry conferences and facilitating portfolio / theme conversations with banks/VC/PE/Growth Equity.

This individual will also be called upon to program manage confidential deal-related projects. This will include coordination across multiple x-functional, time-sensitive workstreams, including management meetings, event management and project coordination.

There will be growth opportunities to also grow project management skills in a deal and post-merger integration context.

What you need to succeed

3+ years of proven experience providing project and program coordination support

Experience prioritizing multiple projects

Interest in gaining project management experience (PMP or similar certification)

Ability to succeed in a fast paced, ambiguous environment.

Excellent written & interpersonal communication skills.

Expertise in Microsoft Office Tools, including Sharepoint

Previous M&A or Business Operations experience preferred.
