What you’ll do

Collaborate with Product Management, Architecture, Engineering, and business partners to execute against Workfront’s product strategies.

detailed project plans and milestones, resource allocations, risks/issues remediation, status reporting, budget management, and is the general “go to” person for details & status of the project.

Maintain a deep, technical end-to-end understanding of the solution being built, its upstream and downstream dependencies and impacts, and proliferate the awareness and necessary changes needed to support the initiative.

Be seen as a Subject Matter Expert, and can cover for any other role in the meeting: Product Management, Engineering, Architecture, QA, etc. You will have a firm understanding of the business goals, and find creative solutions for engineering problems yielding the fastest time to market.

Oversees multiple concurrent projects and programs; varying in size/scope/complexity, spanning across several different teams and orgs.

Participates with management teams in creating materials and models used for quarterly and annual recasting of initiatives and priorities.

Creating material(s) that can be consumed at various levels of the organization – from executive-level presentations, to finite-level materials to be consumed by project/program teams.

Proactively identifies risks in all assigned areas; work with teams and management to mitigate these risks before they become issues.

from front-line team members to VPs, communicating continuously to partners throughout the organization, including C-level executives.

Understand and bring clarity to complex technical challenges, and successfully articulate and navigate through options that deliver the best customer experience

Be relentless in the pursuit of delivery excellence; ensure ALL project/program team members have clear line of sight on the goals, expectations, and success criteria, and are setting the table to ensure success.


Extremely organized with impeccable attention to detail; understands the what, why, when, how and who to drive better solutions.

Self-starter w/ 7+ years of progressive project/program management experience on large scale initiatives; background in business process management and PMO-best practices a strong plus

Working industry knowledge of B2B (SMB + Enterprise) software licensing, deployment, management, and administration (from both the provider and customer POV).

Experience in an always-on, services based infrastructure/architecture, ensuring seamless customer experiences; scaled to address future demands

Working amongst competing priorities and competing schedules to get your project across the finish line in a mode that brings value to stakeholders inside and outside Adobe.

Must know their audience; be comfortable presenting to everyone from C-level to the Individual Contributor assigned to the project/program; must be able to influence, and have data-driven conversations.

Be able to work well across organizations in a matrixed; globally-diverse workforce

Solid knowledge of the Scrum methodology

Familiarity with industry terminology (Marketing, PLG)

Familiarity with compliance (PII, usability, GDPR, data retention and usage, security practices, SDLC constructs, etc.)

Experience with applications such as Workfront, Jira, or other workload (Backlog) management tools required

Bachelor's degree / 8+ years of progressive experience

Title: Senior Engineering Program Manager
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Principal Project Manager’s focus is to work directly with our largest and most challenging customer relationships and services programs across multiple verticals. Principal Program Director will drive customer’s enterprise solution development and implementations by means of the Adobe Experience Cloud.
The PM partners with Adobe’s customers to understand their priorities and objectives and lead a multi-disciplined delivery team from Adobe to design, implement and scale the solutions to drive value for the customer across the intersection of people, process and technology. PMs will work at multiple levels with the Adobe team, including Project Managers, Sales, Finance, Engineering and Systems Integrator Partners. You will evaluate the proposed solution, assess and manage risks, plan the program-wide implementation, support the program delivery, and manage it’s overall success. You will oversee delivery and acceptance of the program scope as defined in one or many statement(s) of work using our consulting methodology including program tasks, deliverables, milestones, and resources, all the time coordinating with project managers and delivery teams as needed. You will ensure successful customer outcomes based on program defined objectives. You will govern overall standards across the program teams to achieve these results. The PM is the senior-most delivery leader and “owns the consulting business” for that engagement. Project Managers are accountable for the successful execution of services programs, acting as a primary point of accountability for the customer, and building relationships with both customer stakeholders and internal teams.
Responsibilities
Act as Lead Consultant on large, complex customer engagements that may involve multiple project managers and teams from Adobe, Client, or partner organizations
Strong executive presence, including ability to partner with and effectively influence client managers, directors, VPs, and CXOs
Clearly understand and communicate customer requirements and integration points in the context of the statement of work and support mutual understanding of Adobe’s unique and transformational business capabilities and evangelize how those capabilities create long-term value for the customer across various customer business units & organizations
Oversee program delivery process with key contributors to help manage scope and prepare change requests, including tasks, deliverables, milestones, resources, and estimated costs.
Creative problem-solving skills, including the ability to understand the impact of technical & process changes and to articulate high-level technical solutions to address business problems
Build and leverage relationships within Adobe to solve very complex customer problems, including working with product teams to enhance solutions.
Accountable for all foundational activities of the program from inception to closure including solid governance, communication and change management with customer teams and internal Adobe teams
Lead regular communication with both the customer and internal teams, and tie back our execution to customer expectations.
Achieve customer satisfaction through successful delivery of defined program scope successful realization of key business objectives and metrics.
Accountable for collating customer requests and deployment issues, and feedback into core products channel.
Support work tracks that may involve third-party subcontractors and technology partners as required.
Act as the central client point of contact throughout the life of the program, including supporting sales in change control support for scope changes, and onboarding of Project Managers and technical teams for new work tracks or projects.
Facilitate capturing and communicate experiences in formal post-mortem, feeding lessons learned, best practices and resources back into the consulting practice.
Provide oversight for services engagements to ensure adherence to governance standards and support customer success by means of Adobe Consulting’s tools and processes
Accountable for escalation leadership across Adobe including sales, services, and product organizations.
Partner with our Sales organization to strategize new consulting opportunities or grow a defined account based on current engagement.
Elevate and encourage your team through caring, effective leadership
Apply Adobe’s Service Governance and Delivery Methodology, apprentice others in the methodology and drive practice and process improvements. Requirements
10 to 15 years of experience leading projects in a consulting and/or technology professional services organization, including delivering enterprise-scale implementations
Innovative thinker.
Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills.
Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead teams identifying issues, solve them quickly and well, and rely on internal resources to assist, when needed.
Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills.
Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe, and communicating with client managers, directors, and VPs including CXOs.
Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated programs with multiple projects at a business or solution level.
Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual and dispersed teams.
Prior experience with the launch and operation of a highly available, high traffic internet or mobile service.
Proven ability to understand the impact of technical changes, and to articulate high level technical solutions to address business problems as well as guide business and technical teams to solve complex project challenges.
Solid understanding of custom software development processes and engagement methodologies. Practical experience in managing Agile development projects.
HTML, HTML5, XML, Java, WCM, Web analytics, content targeting
Solid understanding of and experience with one or more of the following: Web Content Management, Rich internet applications, Web & Social Analytics, online ad targeting and content personalization.
Ability to manage yourself and others in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders both internal and external.
Ability to build strong relationships and generate opportunities for repeat business.
Proven ability to support practice and program development within a Consulting organization.
Proven experience managing off-shore teams.
Willingness to travel up to 60% Desired
MBA
Experience as a consulting manager in a top-tier management consulting firm OR as an accountable and practitioner manager / director from a customer organization is preferred
6 or more years managing Agile development projects
Well versed in multiple delivery methodologies such as water-fall, Six-Sigma, Agile, Kanban, Scrum
Certified ScrumMaster, PMP Certification
Adobe Experience Cloud implementation experience

Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City.
New York Starting Salary $161,200 - $209,300

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Title: Senior Engineering Program Manager
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
We are looking for a n Engineering Program Manager who loves working with people, process, and systems to help Adobe scale to meet the needs of thousands of our B2B customers.
In this role, you will be a scrum product owner for quote-to-cash process and system solutions and design processes and tools for initiatives focused on operational efficiencies, compliance, M&A integration, revenue growth, and customer retention. This is an outstanding opportunity to collaborate with product , engineering, IT, and all supporting functions in Finance and Operations!
What you'll Do .

Operationalize strategic plans by designing and documenting end-to-end workflows in collaboration with impacted stakeholders, IT, and engineering teams.

Create, prioritize, and test user stories as a scrum product owner based on stakeholder needs, project dependencies, and overall strategy.

Build partnerships with key stakeholders to lead them through impact analysis , user acceptance testing, and adoption of changes required to deliver business value.

Serve as a business process and systems subject matter expert for internal and customer facing issues.
What you need to succeed

7 + years of experience in an operational role working with engineering

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to research and identify issues, root cause, and proposed resolution.

Excellent communication, listening and interpersonal skills at all levels of the organization

Proven confidence and flexibility in dynamic environments with ability to adapt to shifting priorities

Approach work with positive energy, curiosity, and a commitment to continuous learning.

Work with different Microsoft tools (Excel, PowerPoint , Dynamics ) and various ERP and CRM tools.

Scrum and change management certification a plus

Title: Senior Engineering Program Manager
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity:
The Global Recurring Revenue Strategy and Operations team works to advise Adobe’s senior leadership on strategies for improved renewal and retention across the Digital Experience (DX) lines of business and all geographies. Our goal is to bring together targeted programs and initiatives with leading operational approaches to deliver high-impact recommendations that help the field team scale and compete. Our remit includes both the creation of recurring revenue strategy as well as working with the broader organization on scale, global rollout and change management.


Work closely with Product and Retention Strategy & Operation teams to coordinate, develop, & deploy short term and long-term retention programs;
Manage all aspects of program development & execution for assigned retention programs, including: solicit & manage contributions from Customer Success, Sales, Marketing, Solution Consulting, partner teams and renewals operation;
Communicate programs using established communication mediums, including email, webinars, newsletter submissions and participating on team calls;
Suggest and implement recommended improvements to address issues that arise;
Post-mortem analysis & recommendations to be used in future program development;
Perform ad-hoc analysis as required to identify and support programs and/or assigned business objectives, including;
Work closely with data teams to identify appropriate data sources for analysis, and collect/download data from internal systems;
Apply critical thinking to validate data and results, applying attention to detail;
Assist in Go To Market planning and execution of programs and processes; and
Evangelize Retention programs with internal and external teams (Customer Success, Sales, Renewals, Marketing, Sales Operations, Partners).


MBA or equivalent advanced degree
Demonstrated passion for digital experiences and/or cloud technology
3+ years of exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills, including conducting customer and market research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work effectively with people at all levels
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas both verbally & in writing
Comfortable working on multiple projects and able to shift priority as needed while maintaining high quality results
Advanced knowledge of Excel
Attention to detail and pride in delivering your best work
Curiosity, initiative, and the desire to experiment
Bonus Points
Work experience at a leading technology company, strategy consulting organization, digital agency, or marketing department
Deep knowledge of the technology industry including direct-to-consumer and/or business-to-business models
Experience creating GTM strategies along with a practical understanding of the technologies and tactics necessary for execution

Title: Data Analyst Senior - Adobe Analytics
Job_Description:
Purpose of Job We are looking for a passionate mid-level candidate with digital measurement and analytics experience in the Banking industry who can drive improvements in digital measurability, analyze data for practical insights, and promote findings across multiple business areas. The analyst selected for this position will get to work with a diverse team of analysts, digital product managers, and developers. They will build measurement strategies and provide analytical decision support to solve sophisticated problems.

We are seeking a versatile Data Scientist Senior for either our San Antonio Home Office, Plano Campus, Phoenix Campus, Charlotte Campus, Colorado Springs Campus, Tampa Campus, or Remote Work Environment available.

Provide decision support for business areas across the enterprise. Staff in this area will be responsible for applying mathematical and statistical techniques and/or innovative /quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make 'insight to action' recommendations to answer business objectives and inspire change. The essence of work performed by the Decision Science Analyst involves gathering, manipulating and synthesizing data (e.g., attributes, transactions, behaviors, etc.), models and other relevant information to make recommendations resulting in implementable strategies.

Job Requirements About USAA
USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.


Identifies and leads existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are optimally identified, measured and controlled.
Follows written risk and compliance policies and procedures for business activities.
Leverages advanced business, analytical and technical knowledge to participate or lead discussions with cross functional teams to understand and collaborate highly complex business objectives and influence solution strategies.
Applies advanced analytical techniques to tackle business problems that are typically medium to large scale with significant impact to current and/or future business strategy.
Applies innovative and scientific/quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make 'insight to action' recommendations to answer the business objective and drive the appropriate change.
Translates recommendation into communication materials to effectively present to various levels of management.
Incorporates visualization techniques to support the relevant points of the analysis and ease the understanding for less technical audiences.
Identifies and gathers the relevant and quality data sources required to fully answer and address the problem for the recommended strategy through testing or exploratory data analysis (EDA).
Integrates/transforms disparate data sources and resolves appropriate data hygiene techniques to apply.
Thoroughly documents assumptions, methodology, validation and testing to facilitate peer reviews and compliance requirements.
Understands and adopts emerging technology that can affect the application of scientific methodologies to problem resolutions.
Succinctly delivers analysis/findings in a manner that conveys understanding, influences various levels of management, garners support for recommendations, drives business decisions, and influences business strategy.
Provides subject matter expertise in operationalizing recommendations.
Cloud, Data Mining, Python, Neural Networks, Sensor data, IoT, Streaming/NRT data).
Finds opportunities to continue to learn in the data and analytics space, whether informal (E.g., Coursera, Udemy, Kaggle, Code Up, etc) or formal


Bachelor's degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other quantitative field OR 4 years work experience in statistics, mathematics or quantitative analytics or related experience can be substituted in lieu of a degree in addition to the minimum years of work experience required.
6 years of data & analytics experience; OR 4 years of data & analytics experience and up to 2 years of progressive functional business relevant experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, Marketing etc.) for a total of 6 years combined experience; OR advanced degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other quantitative subject area and 4 years of experience in data/analytics or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, Marketing, etc.).
Demonstrates advanced skills in mathematical and statistical techniques and approaches used to drive fact-based decision-making.
Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools, data visualization, developing analysis queries and procedures in SQL, SAS, BI tools or other analysis software, and relevant industry data & methods and ability to connect external insights to business problems.
Experience with new and emerging data sets, and incorporation (data wrangling, data munging) into new insights.


Experience with Adobe Analytics and/or Glassbox.
Deep expertise with digital / click-stream data and tagging.
Strong relationship management and negotiation skills; ability to influence senior leadership and drive business results.
Strong experience with complex problem solving and driving large scale transformation.

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.


USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market position. The salary range for this position is: $97,200-$175,000 * .
Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance or at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.

Shift premium will be addressed on an individual basis for applicable roles that are consistently scheduled for non-core hours.


At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.

To see details on our outstanding benefits, visit USAA Total Rewards.
Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

USAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

We are in search of a Research Project Analyst to join our team that supports the U.S. Department of Energy’s National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL), a multi-disciplinary, scientific, and technical-oriented national laboratory that produces technological solutions for America’s energy challenges by driving innovation and delivering solutions for an environmentally sustainable and prosperous energy future that ensures affordable, abundant, and reliable energy that drives a robust economy and national security, while developing technologies to manage carbon across the full life cycle and enabling environmental sustainability for all Americans. Title: Data Analyst Senior - Adobe Analytics
Job_Description:
Our client, an independent wealth advisory firm providing investment management, financial planning and client education services, is seeking a Client Operations Analyst. **This is a hybrid role, Monday/Friday working from home, and Tues – Thurs in the office**
Position Summary: The Client Operations Analyst is part of the Client Operations team, a group whose purpose is to carry out various investment-related tasks assigned by the firm’s consultants. The Analyst will work primarily with the consulting team, third-party account custodians, and third-party investment managers. There will also be some interaction with the firm’s clients during the course of completing their responsibilities.

Title: Data Analyst Senior - Adobe Analytics
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
Adobe Advertising Cloud is looking for a Data Operations professional who will be responsible for the development and maintenance of comprehensive dashboards, source data logic, and performing analysis to identify and resolve potential issues. The ideal candidate is an effective communicator across technical and business teams, and has hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL, SAP HANA, and SFDC. Success is this role is dependent on being organized and solution focused, motivated by operational efficiency, and energized by interaction with key collaborators.
What you'll Do
Enhance and maintain existing Power BI reports and data sources in support of multiple functional teams and leaders.
Design, develop, and drive adoption and utilization of new dashboards and automation tools to streamline workflows and processes, and deliver actionable insights.
Assist with logic development for source data, complex joins, and ongoing integrations and migrations of data platforms.
Relationship management of internal data source owners to ensure alignment, adaptability, and appropriate access levels.
Prepare and maintain documentation for current processes, model structures, and system update processes for existing reports.
Plan, review and implement roadmap for improving current dashboards & systems integrations. What you need to succeed
Ability to communicate and collaborate at all levels; translating complex information into concise, and high-quality insights that resonate.
Expert at working with PBI, SQL, and data modeling. Some knowledge of working with Snowflake, SAP HANA and SFDC.
Proficient in connecting to data sources, understanding application security layer models, and making queries in Power BI desktop.
Strong problem solving and analytical approach; and ability to prioritize and lead multiple ongoing projects.
Degree, certificate coursework, or 4+ years of equivalent practical BI and/or systems experience supporting GTM & Finance functions.

New York Starting Salary $105,600 - $137,100

Title: Data Analyst Senior - Adobe Analytics
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The challenge

Adobe’s Vendor Risk Management Office (VRMO) is looking for Risk Analyst to drive initiatives around vendor data management, process improvements and vendor risk operations at Adobe. The Risk Analyst will partner closely with stakeholders across various risk verticals, source-to-pay teams as well as within the VRMO. As a member of a global team, the Risk Analyst will be responsible for executing projects directly aligned with Adobe’s strategic vendor risk objectives and ensuring that risk processes perform at scale and rapidly adapt to an evolving risk landscape at the company, while also ensuring a world class internal and external customer experience. The position will be at the intersection of risk, systems, and operations at Adobe, and will be instrumental in transforming the way risk is managed across the company’s global supply base.

What you’ll do

Own data integrity on Adobe’s vendor onboarding and risk assessment platform
Perform periodic audits on processes and controls within VRMO to ensure that the department’s strategic direction and decisions are based on a solid foundation of risk data
Deploy cross-functional risk data management and operational improvement initiatives
Using a risk-based sampling approach, perform an evidence-based review of vendor responses to validate completeness and accuracy of vendor risk questionnaires
Deploy process controls and create dashboards to continuously monitor and mitigate process or data gaps
Partner with system owners to design and deliver high quality business solutions on the onboarding platform, including third party integrations that help expand the scope and scale of risk vigilance at Adobe
Partner with various groups like Supplier Compliance, Information Security, Data Privacy, Global Strategic Sourcing and Shared Services Operations, as well as with the Vendor Risk Consultants and System owners within the VRMO to ensure that process and data objectives for all stakeholders are met
Own internal/external audit deliverables for the VRMO
Ensure timely completion of risk mitigation activities by vendors and business owners
Document key operational processes, system configurations and crucial vendors lists
Perform ad-hoc project-based work, including reporting and analyses as required

What you will need to succeed


Ability to analyze large datasets and uncover insights that lead to process improvements
Ability to organize and structure business optimization projects
Ability to translate project requirements into functional and operational change and improvement plans
Insights into third party risk management (TPRM) industry best practices to augment functional operating models
Familiar with data analysis methodologies, tools, and techniques


Demonstrated Ability to dissect, collaborate, and delegate tasks to solve complex business problems
Focused on rapid value creation through quick wins and long-term sustainable value realization
A strong change manager with the tenacity to follow through to closure


Ability to paint exciting visuals for overall project designs and operating models to influence stakeholders and leadership
Strong interpersonal relationship skills, with a distinct ability to influence across organization levels and teams
Maturity to deal with ambiguity and agility to switch gears according to organizational needs and dynamics


3-5 years of progressive experience in Finance, Procurement or Operational Risk roles
Core 1-2 years of demonstrated success in owning/managing business systems and driving process re-engineering/automation efforts.


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent a must; Master’s degree holder in Risk Management preferred
Experience in Risk/Audit management
Proficient in MS Excel
Hands-on with reporting tools like PowerBI, Tableau, etc. (preferred)
Nice to have – Experience with ETL/data-prep tools like Alteryx, SnapLogic etc.

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. Our Company
Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
The Opportunity
The Systems Engineer will be responsible for collaborating with business units to analyze current-state business processes with an emphasis on developing automated reporting and dashboards using BI technology. Also performing ETL (extract, transform, and load), SQL database development, and automated reporting. The Senior Systems Engineer will develop and maintain BI applications for cross-functional teams across our diverse and growing Finance organization. This role will also need to be able to build professional and clean looking dashboards and reporting. Secondarily helping to maintain a SQL server database platform for cross-functional teams across our diverse and growing Finance organization. This role will also need to be able to use ETL software to support incoming and outgoing request. We look for self-motivated individuals who can function and adapt in a development model with iterative delivery, incorporating feedback rapidly into delivery components. Our team partners closely with groups inside and outside of the CFO organization and requires individuals to bring a can-do, positive demeanor, with a focus on delivering exceptional customer support.
Advanced experience with PowerBI, SQL Server, Snaplogic, SQL Server Integration Services, Python, Power Platform, or other similar platforms required.
What you'll Do
Your daily activities include, but are not limited to, supporting, and participating in project planning and communication for PowerBI, SQL, and ETL initiatives. Partnering with others to develop reporting specifications; analyzing and observing processes and developing solutions based on business goals and objectives. Integration of multiple technologies and applications to build comprehensive process automation while ensuring process efficacy and stability is essential to all our project successes.
What you need to succeed
Bachelor’s Degree required (Information Technology or computer science preferred)
5+ Years Industry Experience
Advance experience with BI tool such as PowerBI
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, including business process expertise
Experience with SQL Server or other similar database platform and ETL software
Database design and administration skills a plus
Good interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and written
Committed to finding solutions to challenges and enjoy creative problem solving
Ability to solve problems collaboratively and build strong relationships
Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects
Process orientation with strong attention to detail
Flexible team player committed to quality process and outcomes
Strong self-direction and initiative; willingness to take ownership over projects and tasks Additional Consideration Given
Python and data science experience preferred
Advanced Power Platform experience with PowerApps and Power Automate
At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

Title: Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The opportunity

The Business Platform Architecture Team defines and maintains the architecture of Adobe’s identity, commerce, provisioning, and licensing systems. It’s via these systems that Adobe’s customers discover, try, buy, and use Adobe’s award-winning software applications.

In this job, you'll play a key role in the definition and evolution of our platform architecture. The role focuses on our commerce capabilities: pricing, quoting, check-out, recommendations, and ordering. It requires coordination with your teammates focused on identity, provisioning, and licensing. And Adobe will look to you to develop innovative and intelligent solutions as we expand our product offerings, adopt new monetization models, and scale revenue and transactions.

Responsibilities and opportunities include working with the application teams and our public cloud providers. You’ll work with research to identify and apply transformative technologies, such as machine learning. And you’ll be in a community with the thousands of architects, engineers, researchers, and data scientists who make Adobe’s products the best in the industry.
What you'll do
Provide assessments, strategies, and roadmaps for the architectural and technology evolution of Adobe’s product provisioning and licensing capabilities.
Work with product teams and customers to understand their use cases and requirements and help them understand and adopt the Business Platform.
Develop Proof-of-Concept projects to validate new approaches and technologies.
Propose changes, complete designs, and see them through to production.
Use your system architecture skills to analyze performance, correctness, dependability, efficiency, and other attributes of your and other’s designs.
Participate in mentoring, information sharing, and standards-setting as a member of Adobe’s principal engineering community.
What you need to succeed
Master of Science or higher degree in Computer Science, or equivalent
Proficiency with techniques, patterns, and practices of large-scale system architecture
15 years of industry experience, with 5 years of experience in cloud-scale systems architecture
Extremely strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Working experience with Azure or AWS
Working experience with e-commerce
Experience with Kubernetes, Java, JavaScript, and React is a plus

Requirements
B.A. or B.S. degree – Engineering or related field
Five plus years of field experience; delivering, supporting and troubleshooting AV solutions.
Proven verbal and written communication skills. Communicate technically and or at an Executive level, knowing your audience.
Teams, Excel, PowerPoint and Word for documentation and reporting requirements.
Understand the end-to-end process flow of an AV global deployment.
Knowledge of AV software, architecture, and diverse environments in which they are located.
Possesses the ability to design, propose, setup and test AV IT solutions for conference rooms, custom specialty spaces, auditoriums, and varying environments.
Ability to diagnose and resolved issues with a wide array of hardware and software challenges in a corporate office environment.
Ability to access a situation. prioritize the severity and responding appropriately.
Capable of learning and understanding new technologies quickly and developing a proficiency that establishes confidence and provides results
Qualifications
Experience in large corporations with locations globally.
Ability to operate and travel between different sites and locations, up to 15% travel.
Extraordinarily responsive to customers, services, and satisfaction oriented.
Flexible work hours to provide vital services as needed
Working with teams globally, North America, EMEA, Asia Pac and India
Ambitious, self-starter with a positive, upbeat demeanor
With limited direction, run with tasks, projects, and challenges while delivering on tight schedules
Ability to work in high pressure, multifaceted and accelerated environment
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

Title: Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
This is an exciting opportunity to join the Digital Media Finance team as we continue to propel the business through data-driven forecasts and provide influential insights. In this role, you will have the opportunity to help drive Adobe’s pivotal initiatives by data engineering solutions that connect systems to visualization platforms for management reporting. The position will report to the Group Manager, Business Intelligence and Visualization to drive our systems and automation effort. This position will provide an outstanding opportunity to drive timely insights across Digital Media (DMe) Business at Adobe.
The ideal candidate for this role is a well-rounded top performer with excellent data engineering, analysis, and visualization skills, who will be a catalyst for growth in a fast-paced environment. You should be a strong partner, who enjoys forming cross-functional relationships within Adobe. You will support automating complex financial models, develop engaging and interactive dashboards, streamline processes, and drive efficiencies in management reporting. What you'll Do
Responsible for the strategy and execution of DMe lifecycle of financial and analytics dashboards and ensuring scalability of systems and processes
Manage data transitions and platform migrations between Hadoop/SAP HANA/Snowflake/DataBricks, Tableau/PowerBI, and related ETL processes
Develop data pipelines, connections, and infrastructure to better enable forecasting and data science modelling
Correct data errors via systematic, logical fixes and provide updates within the data pipelines, connections and infrastructures that are built to support the teams
Create documentation and support enablement for the teams who are interested and able to help themselves
Accountable for ad-hoc support & participation in critical business analytics and key project support as directed by management.
Partner closely with IT, Finance Systems, and Finance counterparts to continually improve, streamline & enhance planning and reporting processes. What you need to succeed
BS/BA with preferred focuses in areas of Business, Finance, or Information Systems. Master’s in Data Science a plus
5+ years of experience working with large and complex data structures and develop efficient queries to create calculated fields and data aggregates
3+ years of proven experience designing and developing dashboards using PowerBI
5+ years of relevant experience in data science and analytics in creating/maintaining financial models for a subscription/SaaS business a plus
Proficient in data platforms/systems (such as SQL, Hadoop, Snowflake, Databricks), ETL tools (such as Alteryx, SnapLogic), process automation, and standardization
Self-starter with high attention to details, excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to take charge, set objectives, and deliver results.
Strong project management skills with ability to juggle multiple priorities
Strong team orientation with great customer focus.

Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado.
$105,200 - $136,600

Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City.
New York Starting Salary $132,500 - $172,100

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Title: Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on several Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our regular Check-In approach where ongoing feedback is provided in an open transparent manner.
If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.
Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.
The Challenge
The IT Marketing Solution Services (MSS) team within Cloud Technology is looking for a hardworking senior software engineering lead to bring the skill and knowledge needed to deliver end-to-end solutions that enable Adobe’s lead generation and marketing automation activities in a large, sophisticated enterprise environment. MSS provides & runs the platforms, applications and services that power Adobe’s enterprise marketing business.
You have a passion for technology, process, and a proven sense of curiosity to work through sophisticated marketing challenges at an enterprise scale. You will focus on building new experiences and optimizing end-to-end lead management using Marketo, our custom technology stack, the corporate CRM system, and various integrations where you will need to understand technology in a highly distributed on premise and cloud environment.
Adobe is the team for you if you want to join a team of smart, hardworking analysts, engineers and architects passionate about solving hard problems through dedication and a keen appreciation of craftsmanship in software development!
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
What you’ll do
Collaborate with business partners, architects, technical leads, and analysts to develop high-quality customer centric solutions.
Participate in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, unit testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation.
Solve engineering problems by crafting solutions that use existing technologies and utilize your technical prowess to build and implement solutions where none exist.
Develop, configure and build solutions using Adobe Marketo, Salesforce, dynamics and technologies such as Java, Snap Logic, Kafka, HTML/DHTML, XML, JavaScript, and web services.
Research, build & integrate technologies and open source packages to accelerate and optimize our enterprise stack.
Partner closely with the Adobe Marketo product engineering teams and ensure that proposed solutions align with long term product vision.
What you need to succeed
10+ years of software engineering experience having built highly maintainable, high performance, high quality code with - Java, Javascript, HTTP, XML, AngularJS, and CSS. Experience in Spring Boot framework, ETL tools, Hadoop, Machine Learning, and front-end development are nice to have.
BS or MS in Computer Science or related field
Experience in web services and integrations using HTTP and RESTful design principles
Java/J2EE experience with a solid understanding of end-to-end n-tier enterprise software architectures. Our current infrastructure includes the use of Java, AngularJS, Snap Logic, ActiveMQ, Kafka, relational databases, NoSQL databases, and various managed services (e.g. AWS, Azure)
Application development experience with enterprise CRM software applications such as Salesforce or Microsoft Dynamics preferred
Proven experience using structured, disciplined approaches to solving technical, data, and logical problems.
Deep understanding of SDLC, web technologies, application security, database concepts and software architectures.
Understanding of version control systems (GitHub) and build tools (Jenkins, Maven, and ANT)
Preferred 2+ years’ experience with the Agile methodology, story & sprint tracking tools such as JIRA or equivalent
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Able to clearly articulate sophisticated problems and solutions in terms that others can understand
Experience with integrating with Marketo and Salesforce/Dynamics a plus

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Responsible for developing and testing solutions to solve technical problems in research and development. Assists engineers, inspects products, conducts tests and collects data.
Primary Job Functions:
Perform EMC type testing as per industry standards
Understand and modify Electrical schematics, diagrams and technical documents
Assist Design engineers in verifying product performance and writing of reports to describe the verification
Creating and building test fixtures
Wiring up of panel instrumentation
Test, troubleshoot and repair analog and digital circuitry down to component level

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Responsibilities
What does a Software Engineer do at NSA? The answer changes daily, but always involves solving difficult problems and keeping pace with, or even establishing, the state of the art in software development and system security. Whether an aspiring or established Software Engineer, NSA has opportunity for you to contribute, learn, and grow in virtually any Computer Science focus area, including: Cybersecurity, High Performance Computing (HPC), Quantum Computing Research, Data Analytics, Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (ML/AI), Cryptology/Cryptography, and countless others. If it is considered Computer Science, chances are good we have at least one team focused on it. Individual opportunities are too numerous to list, so tell us what you want to do and let's talk! Given the pace of technology and evolving capabilities and goals of adversaries in the cyber realm and foreign nation state actors, Software Engineers at the NSA are tasked to keep up with and develop technologies/abilities to maintain our advantage in national defense and information gathering. In this role, you will develop the systems needed to manage data (collect, extract value, route, etc.) at scale, build user interfaces, protect the nation's systems, and identify and develop support infrastructure as a service provider to the Agency and Intelligence Community. Make an IMPACT! As a Software Engineer at NSA, the creativity of you and your team is essential to engineering effective solutions for internal and Agency-supported customers around the world. Your efforts will drive global impacts that may include: saving lives of U.S. and ally soldiers; providing U.S. policy and decision makers with critical, timely intelligence; ensuring the continued safety of U.S. citizens and residents by thwarting foreign adversaries; and defending vital networks. Whether your focus is Counter-Terrorism, Cybersecurity, Foreign Intelligence, or providing support to other Intelligence Community agencies, you can take pride in knowing your efforts are protecting others, rather than stuffing a balance sheet.

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. UX at Allstate:

We’re a large and well-respected digital design organization of 115+ passionate UX Designers, Content Designers, Researchers, Visual Designers, and Design Program Managers led by our VP UX. And we’ll be growing by 40% in 2022. We're hiring to evolve UX across dozens of digital products and services and Allstate brands, and to establish a shared design platform: an expanded design system, reusable content, user research and design thinking.


Participate in a collaborative, fun and friendly remote team environment that values diversity, builds and trains individuals, and supports long-term career and skills growth.
Contribute to large-scale digital systems and products that are used by millions of customers and have a meaningful impact on our business.
Join a proven UX organization that is benefitting from high growth, demand, visibility and investment.
Practice true user-centered design, supported by robust research and analytics capabilities.
At Allstate, you’ll help innovate and reinvent insurance and improve customers’ lives by designing products to support them in their moments of greatest need, and you’ll have fun along the way. Join our diverse team of creative problem solvers using our talents for good — at work and in life.


The Sr. Conversational AI Designer uses design thinking and agile methodology to research, create and tune industry-leading chat and/or voice user interfaces from ideation to launch of a product or service and iteratively updates, maintains and tunes existing IVRs, chatbots and SMS text experiences. Daily, you’ll partner with other UX practitioners, researchers, developers, product management, and a variety of business partners to design human-to-computer conversations, architecting the interaction flow and writing scripts.
The Sr. Conversational AI Designer leverages artificial intelligence (AI), natural language processing, and other technology capabilities to define, develop, evaluate, and deliver the user experience of high-profile products & services. They use human-centered design to frame problems and create innovative design solutions that meet user needs and key business objectives for e-commerce, claims, customer support, agent support, billing and payments, and other self-service experiences. This Designer works in lean agile environments committed to quick feedback loops focused on outcomes versus deliverables and communicates concepts and products enhancements using journey maps, flows, prototypes and detailed designs.


Create conversational dialog designs, prompts and scripts for human-machine conversations.
Work closely with product team and business partners to plan, design, optimize and deliver virtual assistants in an agile development environment.
Understand and work closely with developers using working knowledge technology.
Apply user-centered design methods to iterate through concepts that can be tested and validated with users.
Leverage data and user feedback to drive and influence design, business, & technology decisions.
Be open to feedback and engage in active listening.
Model application of human-centered design approaches to frame problems, uncover patterns, discover opportunities, and visualize possibilities.
Communicate clear, focused user experience concepts for products during all stages of the design process, leveraging deliverables such as user journeys, flow diagrams, and prototypes using industry software such as Adobe Creative Suite, Axure, Mural, Voiceflow, Visio, Omnigraffle, Figma, Sketch, Amazon Lex and/or InVision.
Collaborate within product teams – assess and prioritize opportunities, constraints, and features – advocating for the end user while balancing the negotiation of priorities and business goals.
Independently, and in partnership with researchers, facilitate feedback loops through appropriate user research, testing, and metrics analysis to inform decisions & designs.
Continuously grow your depth of knowledge, and apply it, to evolve existing and craft new product opportunities, including information architecture, research opportunities, and platform capabilities.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders , including product owners & engineers, to understand experience and technology requirements, providing creative and thoughtful solutions.
Measure design solutions with metrics that matter; ensure qualitative and quantitative data is captured and used appropriately to inform decisions. Supervisory Responsibilities: This job does not have supervisory duties. Preferred Qualifications:

Five or more years as a UX Conversation Designer in Virtual Assistants, with supplemental work as a UX Writer, or Linguist in highly collaborative environments.
Experience in building user-centered conversational experiences (chat, voice, or SMS) in an agile environment.
Extremely passionate and knowledgeable about conversation design, interaction design and information architecture as disciplines.
Experience with several of the following areas with the ability to leverage working knowledge as necessary: artificial intelligence, linguistics, intent and holistic tuning, natural language understanding, dialog design, and/or speech user interfaces.
Experience facilitating a wide breadth of human-centered design methodologies.
Trained in UX design, computational linguistics, psychology, human factors, or human-computer interaction.
Strong communication, organization, and presentation skills.
Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Linguistic concepts like Pragmatics, Prosody, Morphology and/or the Internet of Things (IoT) and Smart Speakers.
Linguistics, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Psychology, Human Factors.
Experience designing for insurance, financial, or highly regulated verticals is a plus.
A smart, solid portfolio that demonstrates how you think.

Compensation offered for this role is $80,500.00 - $134,800.00 per year and is based on experience and qualifications.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.
As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. For a full description of Allstate’s benefits, visit allstate.jobs/benefits/
Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video .
Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

Elearning focused Adobe Animate Role partnering with a collaborative team, serving national and global clients

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Our client is a maker of spark plugs seeking a UX Design Engineer. The candidate will support a new arm of business which has ventured into the medical space of wearable technology. The ideal candidate should be open to wearing multiple hats and should have prior experience working on the UX design of software for wearables within the medical device space. This is a hybrid opportunity in Santa Clara, CA for anyone located in the Bay Area and who is open to working about 2-3 days onsite.

Responsibilities:
Apply Human Factors techniques and methodologies towards the design and development of medical devices and related software in compliance with FDA and other regulatory standards and guidelines
Lead the design process as part of key development projects
Perform workflow analysis and risk analysis activities such as task and use error analysis. Ensure traceability to design mitigations and requirements for risk areas
Plan and execute usability studies (Formative and Summative), analyze data, document results, and present recommendations to product teams
Utilize UX best practices to create user centric solutions and workflow design
Collaborate with cross functional teams and external companies, coach, facilitate the use of UX best practices, tools, frameworks
Create high-level and detailed wireframes, storyboards, and mockups
Influence adoption of ideas and solutions with key cross functional stakeholders across geographies
Identify and address usability issue while participating in Voice-Of-Customer studies
Work closely with internal and external teams to ensure accurate implementation, compliance of designs

Proven consistent relevant experience in user experience design roles
Ability to share portfolio of work, including the speaking to the story (ex. what the initial problem/project was, how it was tackled, individual contributions, how collaborated with the team, etc.) – must be a good storyteller
Experience in healthcare / medical device space
Strong organizational and planning skills with attention to detail
Experience and expertise in hardware and software design process, interaction design, user research, and usability
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Cloud or other web design tools
Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and wireframes design and statistical analysis tools
Ability to apply user-centered design and usability engineering principles to product research, development, and design
Recommend changes to improve the overall usability, user interfaces and ensure safe and reliable user experience
Time management skills and ability to multi-task with individual initiative (self-starter)
Master’s Degree) – preferably in Human Factors Design, Human Computer Interaction, or other related field

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Role in Adobe Research
Adobe Research is an ideal balance of academic discovery and industry impact. Our passion to invent the future and impact the present is what drives our groundbreaking work. Adobe Research is looking for brilliant minds who are excited about pushing the state of the art in future-looking real-time and edge AI technologies to impact Adobe’s products and future endeavors through next-generation experiences.
We are looking for new college grads with a passion for developing the next generation of ML algorithms, inventing a future where Adobe enables new forms of creativity, frees people from routine tasks, and allows enterprises to understand and act quickly on customer and business insights. Our scientists and engineers are exploring how we can leverage big data to automate decision-making for intervention strategies and to ultimately understand the causal structure within our world. Our technologies help enterprises better understand and strengthen large-scale digital marketing systems. Responsibilities include working closely with other researchers and engineers from product teams to invent the next-generation real-time and edge AI solutions and develop prototypes that showcase new research technologies.


Real-time ML, online Learning, Edge AI
Reinforcement learning, bandits at the Edge
Deep learning, deep reinforcement learning, and representation learning
Causal Inference, counterfactual reasoning
What you will do
Pursue a research problem with applicability to Adobe’s products, and with the possibility of academic publications.
Develop new algorithms, run experiments, and produce demonstration prototypes
Document and present your work, both verbally and in writing
What you will need
PhD in computer science, electrical engineering, or related field
Strong peer-reviewed publication track record
Desire to do world-class publishable research and develop advanced features for Adobe’s experience and creative products. Sufficient research skills and background in your chosen subject area
Solid programming skills
Strong communication and teamwork skills
Working collaboratively with other researchers, you will have access to robust computational resources and world-class product and design teams, empowering you to see your work touch millions of screens across the globe.
We are looking for world-class Research Scientists . In particular, we seek individuals with a passion for innovation through a mix of academic publication, collaboration, and the development of real systems that can be deployed into product.As a Researcher at Adobe, you will be joining a dynamic team of individuals to build the future of digital experiences. You will have the opportunity to develop creative ideas suitable for academic publication, to mentor interns, and to participate in our university collaboration program. You will also work with product teams to implement those ideas as advanced features in Adobe's world-class products, thereby reaching millions of people worldwide.

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Job#: 1278618

Job Description:
Apex Systems is seeking a Sr. Product Designer to sit 100% Remote
**W2 Candidates Only**
If applicable, please send your resume to mvelez@apexsystems.com

Position: Sr. Product Designer
Location: 100% Remote (Round Rock, TX)
Duration: 6-month Contract to Hire

Key Responsibilities
As a Senior Product Designer, you will actively partner with Product and Engineering teams to strategize experiences aligned to business goals. You will cultivate an environment of sustained creativity and professional growth. You will play the role of a player-coach for your design team.

This position is on our AI/ML team supporting the online modernization program.
Team is comprised of 12 designers already and growing with 3 principal product designers onboard.


Explore, design, and validate complex user journeys and user flows for key scenarios
Design low-fidelity and hi-fidelity layouts and key interactions
Take broad conceptual ideas and rapidly turn them into valuable, useful, applications for internal users
Design and contribute components to the Live Style Guide (Figma and Adobe XD)
Collaborate in stand-ups, retros, and working sessions.
Lead workshops and brainstorming sessions
Present to stakeholders
Daily pairing with engineers, POs, business partners
Take the first step towards your dream career

Every team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Able to apply empathy-first and a “yes, and..” mindset to get stuff done
12+ years of related experience in a professional role with a bachelor's degree; or 8+ years with a Master’s degree
Knowledgeable in data-driven design and human centered design
Experienced in working with developers and product managers
Experienced at defining problems and objectives through data, research, and understanding of customers, and letting those objectives inform elegant, practical solutions
An exemplar of excellent communication, facilitation, coordination and organization skills
Experience with designing for complex data visualizations and micro-interactions
Excels in navigating though divergent and convergent discovery-based design thinking
Ability to plan for sprints ahead while executing production-ready, iterative, design


12+ years of related experience
AI/ML experience
Figma experience
Niro experience
W Creative cloud experience

Research, develop, and deploy large-scale machine learning solutions for business
What you’ll Do
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, researchers, and product managers to implement AI/ML solutions into Adobe Experience Platform
Engage with customers to understand and anticipate how machine learning can solve their business problems
Work across organizational boundaries to align on priorities and drive projects forward
Promote accomplishments across the organization, blogs, and conferences
