Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity

We believe AI will revolutionize the next generation of creative tools, automating repetitive tasks while leaving creative agency with the user. This is your opportunity to join a world-class team of researchers, engineers, and software developers who are inventing the next generation of creative tools powered by machine learning. In this role you will work with a team at Adobe Research that incubates new product experiences at the intersection of ML, interaction, and video. You will use your versatile engineering skills and experience building interactive ML systems to code, test, maintain, and improve prototype and product releases.


Write high-quality code with a team across the stack of web-based creative tools. We use TypeScript, React, and Node.js for full-stack web development, and Python for backend ML development.

Write code across various stages of research development, from early prototyping and exploration (quick hypothesis testing) to building product releases (high-quality, efficient, robust code).

Evaluate and integrate novel ML algorithms with an emphasis on the user experience. You will consider usability, explainability, robustness, and ML fairness.

Carefully evaluate ML models. This may involve collecting datasets by designing tasks and guidelines for human judgment jobs to annotate media.

Carefully document all experiments, failure cases, and outcomes.

Build the next generation of creative tools with a multi-disciplinary team of extraordinary engineers and researchers. This is a “best of both worlds” opportunity where you’ll have the flexibility, scope, and personal impact of joining a startup, but also the deep resources, cool perks, and global launch stage that only an industry leader like Adobe can offer.


A PhD in Computer Science or related field with a focus at the intersection of human-computer interaction and ML or computer vision.

Interest and experience with creative tools.

A strong record of solving challenging user problems demonstrated in scientific publications or other research output.

Experience with both TypeScript and Python. A passion for high-quality software engineering.

Experience working with teams and code review.

Hand-on experience collecting and labeling datasets using human raters.

Understanding of issues around ground truth and training/evaluation data for ML, including human judgment, A/B testing, and ML fairness.

Ability to effectively and convincingly communicate ideas and objectives to audiences of all levels.

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Documents have been integral part of our day-to-day business for centuries. Today’s enterprises leverage documents to drive all essential and business critical processes and functions. In the new era of AI-powered digital business, the documents of the future will be an intelligent interface for business management where people build agreements and relationships to conduct business together in more effective and automated manner at scale. We are looking to hire a Research Scientist with a background in the intersection of machine learning, computational game theory, discrete optimization and decision science to re-invent the future of document for intelligent business at scale

As a research scientist in Document Intelligence Lab (DIL), you will provide technical leadership in research, architect and develop theoretical or data-driven models and solutions at scale regards intelligent business optimization, intelligent negotiation for building agreements and document-driven workflow automation that will drive the next generation of digital business transformation. You will leverage Adobe’s unique data sources and customer relationships which include not only content (such as images, videos, texts, voices, contracts), but also how the customers interacting with those contents (such as authoring, sharing, viewing, retrieving, and collaborating) in the context of diverse verticals (e.g. financial services, healthcare, government and etc.).


Demonstrate technical proficiency in state-of-art methods of computational game theory, decision science and discrete optimization, and strong expertise and skills in related machine learning algorithms
Initiate, lead and execute research initiatives by collaborating with researchers and engineers in cross-disciplinary and cross-functional environment
Keep abreast of the latest developments in the fields by continuous learning and proactively championing new ideas and new problem definitions

Required Qualifications
PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or relevant majors with research specialization in decision science, discrete optimization, game theory, artificial intelligence and machine learning.
Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, R, Java and C/C++
Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability.
Demonstrated track record of innovation and creativity in the decision science, optimization and machine learning domains.
Excellent communication, relationship skills and a strong team player.

Preferred Qualifications
Strong publication records in relevant areas

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. The Opportunity

Adobe Document Cloud is looking for an executive leader to drive AI/ML innovations in our Document Cloud products and services! Document Cloud is the world's leading PDF and e-signature tools solution integrated across desktop, mobile, and web. It enables complete, reliable and automated digital document and signature workflows to drive business productivity and delivers delightful customer experiences.

We’re looking for a leader that has experience creating innovative capabilities in AI/ML with experience delivering those capabilities in products and services. This leader will drive data scientists and engineers to effectively deliver impactful digital experiences for our customers.

This role will lead the team that develops sophisticated automation features for Document Cloud. You will work closely with Machine Learning scientists AND software engineers in your team to build a pipeline of innovations that will continuously roll into our products and services. You will deliver server side, mobile, and desktop components to create the optimum customer experience possible. You will also partner with Adobe Research, and especially the Document Intelligence Lab, to demonstrate their pioneering innovations.


Using the power of Adobe Sensei, you’ll build PDF solutions that will help automate many of the tedious steps in PDF

Build a team that will develop and ship new Deep Learning and NLP models

Guide senior technical and product leaders to deliver innovatio n into Document Cloud.

Partner with the Research team to incubate a pipeline of advanced projects that provide innovative features for documents

Establish a process to migrate those research projects into production, including desktop, mobile, web and back-end server environments

Help establish product solutions for these automation areas that align with our various go to market models

Lead a data team that provides datasets for model training

Present to Adobe’s executive leadership team


Have deep knowledge of machine learning, especially in the NLP and Deep Learning areas

Keep up with rapid innovations in AI/ML across the industry and consistently bring new ideas to the team

Translate machine learning result and insights to a business-centric language with easy-to-understand visualization

Build analytics into your solutions and use that data to help improve the effectiveness of the solution

Partner with research labs at Adobe to drive new innovations

Mentor an impactful team and hire exceptional talent

Work with cross functional teams in multiple geographies

Guide internal and external customers in their AI Transformation

Represent Adobe and provide thought leadership in various conferences and meetups.

Have hands-on experience developing data science solutions, from concept to production, and selecting the right tool for the job at hand.

Be familiar with and be able work with popular ML frameworks.

Continually research and evaluate emerging technologies.

Be a critical thinker who is passionate about developing highly innovative breakthrough technologies and has the resilience to make innovation happen.

Be obsessed over delivering products that solves critical business needs and iterating with customers for early feedback.

Have experience interacting with enterprise customers

Have experience leading data science teams, provide technical leadership that can keep the team focused on priorities.

Communicate complex ideas clearly.

Ideally PhD/Masters in Computer Science or similar field

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Senior Data Analyst
Dell Technologies is driven by data. Our business is built on the understanding that data creates value and drives progress. So, we take the stewardship of our data very seriously. That’s the vital role played by Business Intelligence teams within Business Support. Internal clients across Dell rely on us to analyze, test, validate and maintain the integrity of data. We make use of leading-edge software and tools to collect, mine and interpret data and the statistical analyses and reports we produce inform decisions with a global impact.
Join us as a Senior Data Analyst on our Digital Services Analytics team remotely in Brazil to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve
As a Senior Data Analyst you will be responsible for managing analytics projects, delivering analytical insights to provide actionable recommendations to influence Digital Services/Services IT product development and to optimize user experience by considering the speed, stability, and user behaviors of the applications. You will also work with data engineers, data scientists, architects, application product managers, software developers, UX designers, and business partners to build AI/ML solutions to improve user experience and application performance.

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.
As a Compute and Networking Business Unit (CNBU) Architecture Engineer at Micron Technology, you will develop optimized solutions that are focused on next generation datacenter/cloud, networking, and client systems. These products drive a significant portion of Micron’s revenue and include DDR5, DDR6, LPDDR5x, LPDDR6 and CXL-attached memory solutions. You will develop a deep understanding of Micron’s technologies and capabilities, as well as key market trends and competitive landscapes. You will be responsible for building strong technical relationships with system architects and key technologists across the industry and will represent Micron at technical conferences and consortia. Your role in those industry engagements will be to drive pathfinding discussions, influence design-in decisions and negotiate product requirements with our ecosystem partners and customers. Internally, you will partner with Micron’s top R&D, Design, Test, and Product Engineers to ensure successful implementation of new product concepts. This role works closely with Product Managers and Business Development Managers to ensure that each technical decision is aligned with business objectives and strategy.

Our Company

Adobe's EPG (Emerging Product Group) is seeking a senior Mobile Developer to join our team in San Jose, California. If successful it will grow to become a technology platform for other Adobe products, with the opportunity for broad impact.

If you are passionate about mobile photography and AI this is your opportunity to work with a truly great team on some really exciting projects.

Our team works like a startup inside Adobe, making this is a unique “best of both worlds” opportunity. Understanding of core CS including data structures, algorithms and concurrent programming
Collaborate with our designers, product managers, researchers and visual effects engineers.

5+ years of industrial experience in developing large applications.
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent.

Proficient in Swift is a plus
Knowledge of GPU and Image/Video Processing, and experience in iOS and/or Android camera capture pipeline as a plus.

Title: Engineering Technician
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Adobe Research is looking to hire a Senior Research Scientist to push the boundaries of multimedia systems technologies and enable next-generation content experiences. We are specifically looking for established researchers who can amplify our ongoing research in live streaming of image and video content, low latency compression and co-editing experiences in the Real-time Experiences and Algorithms Lab in San Jose. Responsibilities include working closely with researchers, engineers, user experience designers, and product managers to spearhead research in compression algorithms for images and videos, data-driven content generation and multimodal transformation, image and video understanding, novel content streaming and consumption experiences and engagement prediction. The research should be showcased by compelling prototypes which can influence Adobe’s position, and result in high impact features in products, along with patents and premiere conference publications. Other important responsibilities include keeping up to date with the latest research advances and integrating these into our platform. Our lab plays a key role in creating next-generation applications and banner features in Adobe Creative, Document, and Experience Clouds.

Adobe Research blends innovative academic discovery with industry impact. Our scientists are provided with the resources, support, and freedom to shape their ideas into innovative technologies and products. They collaborate with colleagues at over fifty universities, often presenting their work at world-class international conferences. Many of our researchers’ discoveries are incorporated into Adobe’s products, building the company’s reputation as a pioneer in content and data intelligence. Our lab has an excellent track record of impactful product features and an excellent publication record with dozens of papers at leading AI and ML conferences and journals. Some of our research topics include Real-time ML, Online Learning, Edge AI, Reinforcement Learning, Deep learning, Deep Reinforcement Learning, Representation Learning, Homeostatic & Self-Healing Systems, Systems for ML, Data Ingestion and Storage for Data Lakes, Video Editing and Delivery, Immersive Media, Causal Inference, and Counterfactual reasoning.

Adobe is one of the largest software companies in the world, and a market leader in three major areas: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and the Experience Cloud. Collectively, the three clouds process several trillions of interactions with content and transactions every year, involving hundreds of petabytes of data. This data offers researchers unparalleled opportunities for exploring web scale solutions for AI and ML.
What you’ll do
As a senior researcher, help drive the technical agenda in several critical areas, including developing the next generation of image and video editing workflows especially through AI/ML for compression and streaming of multimedia content, .
Responsible for providing technical leadership across multiple teams, by understanding the technical space deeply enough to help guide corporate and business strategy, or by providing innovations that fuel the growth of Adobe.
Be able to lead cross functional working groups or initiatives or provide consulting/advice to other departments or groups within the company.
Partner with the existing research teams at Adobe, including world class experts in AI/ML, computer vision, deep learning, NLP, graphics, and HCI.
Provide critical analysis of issues for continuous improvement of technology, process, and team productivity.
Act as an industry evangelist, internally and externally. Engage with the research community, including university faculty collaborations, intern recruiting and mentorship, and publishing and participation in respected conferences. Help attract world class talent to Adobe.
What you need to succeed
PhD in Computer Science, EE, or an equivalent field and at least 3 years of experience in Multimedia Systems Research
Prior experience working with product teams and delivering powerful research into products
Recognized by peers in industry, academia, or the research community
Recognized technical expertise includes but is not limited to publications, editorial and advisory boards, conference/symposium presentations, patents, professional peer recognition and strategically meaningful developments, innovations, or technical contributions
Demonstrated experience in mentoring and coaching interns, and junior technical contributors.

Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. Title: Network Engineer
Job_Description:
Responsibilities
What does a Software Engineer do at NSA? The answer changes daily, but always involves solving difficult problems and keeping pace with, or even establishing, the state of the art in software development and system security. Whether an aspiring or established Software Engineer, NSA has opportunity for you to contribute, learn, and grow in virtually any Computer Science focus area, including: Cybersecurity, High Performance Computing (HPC), Quantum Computing Research, Data Analytics, Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (ML/AI), Cryptology/Cryptography, and countless others. If it is considered Computer Science, chances are good we have at least one team focused on it. Individual opportunities are too numerous to list, so tell us what you want to do and let's talk! Given the pace of technology and evolving capabilities and goals of adversaries in the cyber realm and foreign nation state actors, Software Engineers at the NSA are tasked to keep up with and develop technologies/abilities to maintain our advantage in national defense and information gathering. In this role, you will develop the systems needed to manage data (collect, extract value, route, etc.) at scale, build user interfaces, protect the nation's systems, and identify and develop support infrastructure as a service provider to the Agency and Intelligence Community. Make an IMPACT! As a Software Engineer at NSA, the creativity of you and your team is essential to engineering effective solutions for internal and Agency-supported customers around the world. Your efforts will drive global impacts that may include: saving lives of U.S. and ally soldiers; providing U.S. policy and decision makers with critical, timely intelligence; ensuring the continued safety of U.S. citizens and residents by thwarting foreign adversaries; and defending vital networks. Whether your focus is Counter-Terrorism, Cybersecurity, Foreign Intelligence, or providing support to other Intelligence Community agencies, you can take pride in knowing your efforts are protecting others, rather than stuffing a balance sheet.

Job_Description:
Description:
M-F OT is rare
Travel 20% potential. Travel would consist of site visits and public open house visits. Travel will mostly be daytrips within the state of Ohio An occasional overnight stay is possible.
Some flexibility in bill rate. Potential to convert. As a reminder, AEP does not sponsor.

This role is designated as Hydrid work. Work on location Mondays and Tuesdays, remaining days remote work. First day will start in office. Local candidates to Columbus or New Albany, OH and surrounding areas only.

This role is responsible for coordinating the siting studies for multi-million dollar electric transmission line and substation projects. Projects can range from small scale to hundreds of miles in length traversing multiple states. Understand the full range of issues related to the successful siting and routing of a transmission project and will be accountable for making sound recommendations and decisions. Areas of required expertise include environmental (cultural, natural and visual resource assessment), utility corridor siting (utility regulatory requirements, stakeholder interaction, and permitting requirements) and project management.


1.) Ensure that transmission siting activities are performed in accordance with the policies, practices and standards of the Company and regulations and procedures as required by federal, state or local regulatory agencies.
2.) Organize the siting studies and proposed route selection activities to meet in-service dates and ensure compliance.
3.) Oversee the oversight of outsourcing related to siting and regulatory approvals of transmission lines and substations
4.) Work interdependently with a multidisciplinary project team to identify buildable, cost effective routes and facilities which minimize environmental impacts.
5.) Serve as liaison with AEP Environmental Services, Outreach, Engineering, Project Management, Planning, and ROW on aspects of the projects.
6.) Determine siting risks, tasks, scopes, and cost estimates.
7.) Assist in and prepare siting studies for transmission facility projects.
8.) Coordinate regulatory and local zoning applications (writing, exhibits, testimony, interrogatories, schedule, etc.); Ohio Power Siting Board experience is highly preferred.
9.) Develop and monitor schedules to complete siting tasks and manage identified risks.
10.) Participate in stakeholder meetings and public workshops.
11.) Assist in preparing testimony and testify before federal, state and local agencies concerning transmission routing and substation siting.
12.) Organize and facilitate project meetings related to siting activities.
13.) Assist in evaluating the impact of proposed legislation and regulations on transmission projects and provide input to the development process.
14.) Build networks that extend through AEP and other companies, and regulatory agencies.
15.) Improve standardization and process development.
16.) Make presentations to civic groups, property owners, regulatory agencies, and AEP employees.
17.) Perform other duties as requested or assigned.

Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Environmental Science, Land Use Planning, Urban Planning, Landscape Architecture, or related field.

One to two years' total industry experience. Proficiency with ESRI ArcGIS, Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office computer applications. Excellent written, organizational, presentation, oral communication and time management skills. The ability to handle multiple projects and assignments is critical.


1. May require extended hours to accomplish assigned tasks to meet requirements and schedules.
2. Some overnight travel to facilities and projects (field work) is required periodically.
3. Position requires some travel and exposure to situations which require knowledge, understanding, and adherence to applicable safety procedures, and ability to hike one to three miles.
4. 20 to 30 % of travel time associated with this position.

Siting experience preferred but not required. Urban planners, GIS users, Engineers, or Environmental Scientists preferred degree/experience.AEP Work Designation (hover here for descriptions) Hybrid

Title: Network Engineer
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
We are growing our team that provides successful and timely technical support to Adobe Digital Media customers.
Members of this team will be expected to rapidly troubleshoot issues, diagnose and replicate problems, evaluate resolution options and develop reliable solutions in a technical support role.
Our team members take care of the customer by maintaining ownership, offering expert advice and resolving complex technical problems. Specifically, the role encompasses inbound issue reception, triage and analysis, technical issue diagnosis and resolution identification; documentation, tracking and recording of all issues and interactions. We partner with internal Adobe teams (Sales, Engineering, Customer Success, Professional Services and others) to address complex issues for which no immediate solution is available.
What you'll do
Working from our office in Lehi, you will support enterprise-level Adobe customers using Creative Cloud and other products through phone, web portals, email and chat
As a top tier support resource, utilize advanced troubleshooting skills and root cause analysis to facilitate timely resolution of customer issues, often under high-pressure and escalated situations
Own issues from initial contact through resolution, raising critical support issues from customers to the appropriate internal channel
Assist customers and partners in configuring and deploying enterprise software solutions using a variety of industry-standard deployment methodologies
Research, replicate and report bugs and work with the Quality Engineering, Engineering, and Product Management teams to prioritize urgent and top issues for resolution
Work closely with the Product and Engineering teams to share customer insights and enhance our product based on customer experience and needs
Effectively utilize support/diagnostic tools, case management systems, use/update knowledge base articles, and communicate effectively through case documentation
As required, participate in off-hours support activities including a rotational on-call schedule
Achieve performance targets including case status updates, resolution time, open case aging, first contact resolution rate, case quality and customer satisfaction
What you need to succeed
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent experience.
3-5 years of experience in a technical support or engineering position
Strong structured problem resolution skills
Highly technology literate, knowledge of complex network, browser and software systems, with excellent and proven knowledge applicable to Adobe’s products and technologies such as our design or imaging applications
Detailed knowledge of Windows, Windows Server and Mac operating systems including Microsoft Installer Technologies and deployment methods
Technical knowledge of virtualization technologies and their use, networks and permissions, digital certifications and XML schemas
Deep understanding of Identity and Access Management, Single Sign-On, SAML, enterprise software deployment technologies
Excellent customer presence and exceptional verbal and written communication skills with an ability to influence others and gain acceptance for ideas, sometimes in sensitive situations
Able to thrive in a fast-paced, matrix-managed, distributed environment, performing effectively on multiple priorities, while providing timely resolutions in a high-pressure environment

Title: Network Engineer
Job_Description:
About Stellar Health:
Historically, US Healthcare has relied on a fee-for-service reimbursement system where providers are paid based on the quantity of patient visits and procedures, rather than the quality of health outcomes.
At Stellar Health, we help primary care providers put patient health first. Our platform - a mix of technology, people, and analytics - supports providers at the point of care, delivering real-time patient information, activating practice staff, and empowering providers and care teams with incentives that reward the work they are already doing to keep patients healthy. Using the Stellar App, our web-based, point-of-care tool; practices receive a simple checklist of recommended actions that support the best quality care. Providers and care teams are then paid monthly for each action they complete, and Payors save money in reduced healthcare costs along the way.

Title: Network Engineer
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
Network Engineering is seeking a Sr. Wireless Network Reliability Engineer to join a team of hardworking and highly skilled Network Engineers. This team is responsible for engineering and maintaining a large-scale, high-availability campus network infrastructure that support Adobe offices worldwide. This is a highly-technical, fast-paced, and exciting atmosphere as we support Adobe employees as they return to the office.
What you'll Do


Define and support architecture and standards for wireless access points, antennas, cabling, and controllers across the enterprise.

Determine business requirements and work with partners/vendors to build and implement solutions.

Prepare, review, and approve documentation and configurations for wireless access points, antennas, cabling, and controllers.

Develop solution designs, conduct peer design reviews, and issue change requests to service suppliers while adhering to service lifecycle and technology roadmaps.

Provide incident support and troubleshooting.

Prepare, review, and approve wireless RF surveys and interpret results.

Participate in a follow-the-sun on-call rotation.
What you need to succeed
The successful candidate will demonstrate experience or capability in the following areas:

BS in Computer Science, IT, or related field or equivalent experience.

5+ years of hands-on expertise in designing, deploying, and administering highly-available and clustered Cisco wireless infrastructure.

Experience with Cisco wireless technologies including WLC 5508/5520/9800 controllers, 9100/x800 access-points, and Prime/DNAC platforms.

Broad understanding of Wi-Fi RF characteristics and signal propagation, including experience working with predictive and active surveys using tools comparable to Ekahau.

An understanding of enterprise wireless authentication methods including 802.1x, EAP, RADIUS, etc.

Expert understanding of IP networking fundamentals and ability to work with LAN network engineers.

CCNP wireless, CCIE wireless, or CWNP certification preferred.

Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills.

Excellent analytical, problem solving, and technical troubleshooting skills.

Effective at short-term actions that are consistent with long-term goals.

Ability to optimally prioritize and execute tasks in a dynamic and high-pressure environment.

Desire to challenge yourself, learn, and continually improve.

Title: Network Engineer
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Our company:
Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
Take a peek into Adobe life in this video .


We're on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to crafting exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to an equal opportunity. We realize that new insights can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours.

Join an agile network engineering team to help drive automation efforts. You will architect, develop, and release new solutions, working to deliver services at scale to Adobe customers. This Sr. Cloud Network Developer will work closely with Senior Automation Developers to help increase the simplicity and agility of platform and infrastructure Services which support our Cloud and Data Center locations.

What you’ll need to succeed
The successful candidate will demonstrate experience or capability in the following areas:
Experience with Data Structures and Algorithms.
Experience of coding in one of the following programming languages including: Python (preferred), Perl, Ruby, Java or C
BS in Computer Science, IT, or related field or equivalent experience.
5+ years hands-on expertise in implementing, administering, and solving network infrastructure problems, including routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, access switches.
Experience with Cisco networking, switching, and routing technologies, IOS, IOS-XE, and NX-OS.
Load balancing and firewall experience such as F5, Citrix, Avi, Cisco ASA/Firepower, Palo Alto
Experience with network automation tools such as Ansible, Git, SaltStack, Cisco DCNM, etc.
Experience with L2/L3 protocols such as BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, MPLS, STP, FabricPath, VXLAN and EVPN.
Experience with public cloud network design, connectivity, and management (AWS, Azure, GPC).
Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills.
Excellent analytical, problem solving, and technical troubleshooting skills.
Effective at short-term actions that are consistent with long-term goals.
Ability to optimal prioritize and execute tasks in a dynamic and high-pressure environment.
Desire to challenge yourself, learn, and continually improve.

What You’ll Do


Desire to challenge yourself, learn, and continually improve.
Tackle sophisticated business and technical problems involving public cloud and on-prem data center environments.
Gain a proven understanding of the Adobe network infrastructure and drive solutions that simplify and automate portions of the infrastructure.
Work with a team of dedicated and experienced network and development engineers to provide outstanding services for Adobe products worldwide.
Design, deploy, and maintain data center network infrastructure in many colocations around the world.
Challenge everything and ask if it can be automated or done in code.
Monitor network and systems health, responding appropriately to network alerts and events to diagnose and fix network issues.
Communicate with other technical and solution teams to understand network requirements and deploy solutions that meet requirements.
Review architectures, configurations, and network tools to continually improve network performance and reliability.
Contribute as a network domain specialist to projects involving multi-functional technical teams, internal business and engineering customers, and external partners.
Create and maintain network documentation.
Adhere to Change Control policy requirements and availability mandates/requirements.
Work a flexible schedule allowing network maintenance during off-peak (late evening and weekend work as necessary).
Keep abreast of technological developments and maintain up to date knowledge and skills across key platforms.
Support automation/orchestration of alerts and remedial tasks to increase availability and agility.
Participate in an on-call rotation.

We’re glad that you’re pursuing career development opportunities.

Schedule a Check-in meeting with your manager to discuss this internal opportunity and your career aspirations.
Check-ins should include ongoing discussions about expectations, feedback and career development. Learn more about Check-in here .

Title: Information Technology Specialist
Job_Description:
Genwest Systems Inc., an equal opportunity employer, is currently accepting applications for an Instructional Designer/Training Specialist. This position will primarily support our clients at the National Oceanic & Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Response and Restoration (OR&R) Disaster Preparedness Program (DPP) and will be based from NOAA offices at Seattle, WA; Mobile, AL; or Silver Spring, MD.
POSITION BACKGROUND:
This position supports the DPP mission to ensure NOAA, NOAA partners, and coastal communities are better prepared for, respond to, and recover from coastal hazards and disasters including natural and human caused events such as hurricanes and major oil spills. DPP mission activities are subdivided into six task categories (or topic portfolios): Continuity of Operations (COOP), Exercises, Incident Management Team Coordination, Lessons Learned/Continuous Improvement, Training, and Recovery. The DPP headquarters office is located in Silver Spring, MD and includes the NOAA Gulf of Mexico Disaster Response Center (DRC) located in Mobile, AL. Organizationally, the DPP is part of the NOAA National Ocean Service’s Office of Response and Restoration (OR&R). The DPP Training Specialist will also work closely with OR&R’s Emergency Response Division (ERD) based in Seattle, WA.

Title: Network Engineer
Job_Description:
Imagine New Horizons…
Help us design realistic simulation software that is used by physical product designers and engineers to explore and optimize the real-world behavior of their products before committing to physical prototypes. They leverage high-performance computing to improve the sustainability, performance, reliability and safety of products in a wide variety of industries including aerospace, automotive, consumer electronics, clean energy, and healthcare. As a Senior UX Designer in the SIMULIA UX team, you will be responsible for leading UX research and design for a suite of engineering simulation software applications.
With the support of our UX Research Lead, you will build an effective and efficient continuous learning process, establishing a feedback loop between the product team and users that will identify the right problems to solve as well as how to build the solutions right. You will plan and conduct both qualitative and quantitative research (such as contextual inquiry interviews, usability studies, surveys, card sorting, etc.) based on project needs and make a plan for integrating research into the team’s development process, understanding that research doesn't have to be perfect and can be improved over time. You can expect to spend about a third to half of your time on UX research.

Job Title :: Dev Ops Engineer
Job Location :: Alhambra, CA
Position Description ::
A DevOps Engineer serves as the engineer of complex technology implementations in a product-centric environment; is comfortable with bridging the gap between legacy development or operations teams and working toward a shared culture and vision; and works to arm developers with the best tools and ensuring system uptime and performance. The DevOps Engineer will deploy and configure services using infrastructure as a service (IaaS) providers (e.g., Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Compute Engine, RackSpace/OpenStack); configure and manage Linux-based servers to serve a dynamic website; debug cluster-based computing architectures; use scripting or basic programming skills to solve problems; install and manage open source monitoring tools; use configuration management tools (e.g., Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Salt); Develop architecture for continuous integration and deployment, and continuous monitoring; and use containerization technologies (e.g., LXC, Docker, Rocket).

Title: Network Engineer
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Our company
Adobe is the global leader in digital media and digital marketing solutions. Our creative, marketing and document solutions empower everyone – from emerging artists to global brands – to bring digital creations to life and deliver immersive, compelling experiences to the right person at the right moment for the best results. In short, Adobe is everywhere, and we’re changing the world through digital experiences.
We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, a culture of inclusiveness, and why we invest in cultivating leaders throughout the organization. Are you passionate about leading and thriving in an open culture of diversity and innovation? Are you eager be at a company where our most valuable assets truly are the people? The challenge
The Adobe Document Cloud organization is looking for talented and highly motivated Software Engineer to help deliver our next-generation experience of document viewing and Signing in Acrobat Web. Adobe Sign revolutionizes the way the world is signing documents. It is the fastest, easiest way to get contracts signed, tracked and filed. Adobe Sign offers an end-to-end solution by automating the entire contract process from the request for signature to the distribution and filing of the executed agreement. Adobe Sign instantly shows you what’s out for signature, what’s been signed, when and by whom. All documents are converted to PDF and automatically routed to all parties. What you will do:
You will be joining a dynamic agile software development team focused on producing secure, scalable and high-quality enterprise solutions.
You will design & develop key UI features, shared components for Acrobat Web Application.
Collaborate with the architects, product manager and the design teams to work on most optimized and delightful user experience.
Partner with core engineering teams to build and to integrate shared components.
You will develop, implement, test, deploy, and support our application.
You will work closely with customer success team and follow-up on customer issues. Your key to success:
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent.
4+ years of software development and engineering, including software design, coding, testing, debugging, and deployment.
Have 3+ years of expert level knowledge of key web technologies (JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS).
Have 3+years proven experience with web frameworks like ReactJS, AngularJS or BackboneJS.
Have experience working with Webpack, GruntJS, Babel, Karma/Jasmine, NodeJS & npm, CSS processing (Less/ Sass) and responsive design.
Have experience building single page web application with cross-browser support, cross-platform.
Be knowledgeable working with server-side development using Java.
Experience in developing and using RESTful API services with JSON, XML.
Experience working with AWS or Azure is a plus.
Ability and willingness to learn new technologies quickly and strong interest in Cloud computing technology stack.
Ability to work independently and strong communication skills within and across teams.
source code control, unit testing, in-code documentation and automated build environments.
Familiarity in API and Data security standards is a plus.
Be a full stack developer but also have domain expertise. Diversity and Equal opportunity
At Adobe, we are committed to hiring the very best and creating exceptional employee experiences.
As part of our dedication to growing, strengthening, and demonstrating diversity in our workforce, we treat all employees with respect and integrity while valuing the differences and mirroring the diversity that exists in the locations where we do business.Adobe is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and as such, administers its personnel policies and conducts its employment practices in a manner that treats each employee and applicant based on merit and experience, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, national origin, or other classification protected by applicable law.

Title: Network Engineer
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Business
The Adobe Experience Cloud solutions provide thousands of enterprises with deep insight into their customers, along with creation and management of content, assets, and personalized campaigns. Adobe Analytics tracks over 80 billion customer interactions a day and provides real time interactive insights into that data.

The Team
We are a core set of senior software engineers with a background in distributed computing running across thousands of nodes and processing billions of events per day. We have a wide range of experience, and we’re looking to further improve those skills by bringing on a new team member to help fortify our engineering achievements. Are you looking for a new challenge that will enable you to work on one of the most exciting data-intensive platforms in the world? If so, this is the team for you!

Job Summary
We need a capable and amiable Engineering Manager with a passion for supporting their team's growth and fostering a culture of excellence. You will work with a broad set of technologies and work closely with our Product and Program Management teams to drive powerful software platforms on private and public clouds. This position demands deep understanding and a history of performance.


Mentor and guide a dedicated team of engineers; hire and retain key talent

Own customer-facing services requiring a minimum of four-nines of uptime including participation in on-call escalations as needed

Review features, architecture, design, code, time & budget estimates, and validation strategies

Collaborate with Product Management and other engineering teams to build the technical vision and road map for the team

Drive multiple simultaneous projects with agile planning, mitigate risks, address problems, and deliver on time

Develop and evolve engineering and business processes to optimize team efficiency

Partner with other teams across Adobe for achieving common goals

Learn new technologies/technical solutions


Being an advocate for your team, helping individuals grow both personally and as a group

Demonstrating past experience developing enterprise software (this is a very technical team requiring a fully-engaged manager)

Leading engineers and projects in an agile environment; JIRA is your friend

Building and maintaining high-scale, data intensive distributed systems

Leading sophisticated projects and delivering solutions under time and resource pressure

Motivating all personalities, whether they are introverts, extroverts, or just bombastic


Driven.

Encouraging.

Fun.

Organized.

Quickly understand existing codebase and contribute significant changes.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Commercial Airplanes is looking for a Mid-Level Computing Architect in User Experience based out of Seattle, Washington. The Network Systems’ Human Machine Interface (HMI) team is looking for a candidate in the definition, design, evaluation, and governance of the next generation of User Experiences in Airline and Cargo operational environments. The operational environments include Onboard, Ground, and Back Office Engineering spanning Flight Crew, Cabin Attendant, Maintenance, and future user roles. Title: Network Engineer
Job_Description:
Requisition Id 5972
Purpose:
The Environmental Sciences Division (ESD) of Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL) has an opening for a Data Systems Engineer in its Earth Sciences Informatics portfolio. You will help develop modular and scalable software tools and infrastructure for data processing and data center operations in the Earth, climate, and environmental sciences, such as the Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Data Center.

Major Duties/Responsibilities:
ARM Data Center processes, archives and distributes atmospheric observations from observatories across the globe and provides computational infrastructure and analysis tools for the scientific community. In this position, you will work independently and as part of a team to research, develop and operate back-end data analysis workflows and processes at scale in a HPC environment. You will have the opportunity to design and develop new creative solutions for increasing large volumes of historical and streaming data analysis on hybrid HPC and cloud computing platforms. This would require formulating necessary solutions using various parallel computing paradigms and tools, HPC schedulers (such as Slurm), Containers and Kubernates, Python, Bash and other scripting/programming languages in the Linux environment. You should be able to configure, deploy and update containers in a Docker/Kubernates environment using GitLab CI/CD pipelines. You should be able to develop documentation for systems/applications deployed. You should be able/willing to learn new technologies/techniques to meet programmatic requirements.

Title: Principal Financial Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
In joining Adobe’s Consumer & Business Finance organization, you will have the opportunity to help drive Adobe’s pivotal initiatives by partnering with the World-Wide Go to Market Teams, operations, and finance organization, to drive retention forecasts. The position will report to the Director, FP&A, retention planning. This position will provide an outstanding opportunity to drive timely insights across Digital Media (DMe) Business at Adobe.
The ideal candidate for this role is a well-rounded top performer with excellent data science and forecast modeling skills, who will be a catalyst for growth in a fast-paced environment. You should be a strong partner, who enjoys forming cross-functional relationships within Adobe. You will drive data science initiatives to create complex financial models for forecasting retention and engagement. What you'll Do
Drive data science modeling initiatives for retention forecasting and analysis.
Ensure accuracy of the models and conducting scenario analysis to derive range of outcomes.
Automate, enhance, and maintain analytic applications and data structures used for modeling and forecasting.
Partner between the go to market and technology teams to ensure clear communications among stakeholders
Demonstrate strong intellectual curiosity and is constantly looking to enhance the current methodologies and processes.
Be a change agent, ensuring users embrace new and innovative technology. What you need to succeed
MS or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative field; Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Operational Research, etc.
10+ years of relevant experience in data science and analytics in creating/maintaining models for a subscription/SaaS business.
Knowledge and understanding of econometric and statistical techniques.
Ability to code efficiently in Python, R and SQL like languages.
Proficient in data platforms/systems (such as SQL, Hadoop, Snowflake), ETL tools (such as Alteryx, SnapLogic), process automation and standardization.
Experience working with large and complex data structures and develop efficient queries to create calculated fields.
Ability to tell stories with data, educate effectively, and instill confidence, motivating leaders and partners to act on recommendations.

As a Data Scientist, you will work with Product, Marketing and Engineering to build the data ecosystem and discover insights. Adding business context to the data insights will allow you to craft compelling narratives that drive decision making. You will have a direct impact on the 3D&I business and product decisions!

Are you passionate about exploring data and create data driven stories? Are you self-motivated with strong interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills? We invite you to apply today!


Work across the 3D&I organization and our partners to uncover insights and guide business decisions

5+ years of professional experience in data science/analytics

statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, engineering, economics, etc.

Strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large datasets using SQL-like languages (Hive, Spark, Presto, Databricks)

Experience designing and analyzing A/B/n experiments, using appropriate statistical techniques to mitigate bias and interpret statistical significance

Familiarity with descriptive and inferential statistics (e.g. t-test, chi-square, ANOVA, correlation, regression, etc.) to understand usage behaviors and generate hypotheses

Experience creating data visualizations and storytelling to effectively communicate analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences (preferably Tableau or PowerBI)

Experience with data science workflows in Databricks, Jupyter, Python, Git

Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a strong standout colleague

Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City.
New York Starting Salary $147,400 - $191,400

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a frontier in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. At Adobe Research, we are particularly interested in NLP for multimodal data, such as joint vision and language, video understanding with transcript, and document understanding. Advancing the state-of-the-art in this area is critical to Adobe’s mission of changing the world through the digital experience.

We are looking for a Research Scientist in NLP and Multimodal Learning to join a world-class Computer Vision, Deep Learning, and Natural Language Processing research lab at Adobe Research. You will initiate and execute research projects in NLP, Multimodal Learning, and related areas relevant to Adobe’s business. You will collaborate with researchers in Natural Language, Computer Vision, and Deep Learning on cross-disciplinary projects and partner with product teams to transfer research outcomes to Adobe products. You will have opportunities to mentor interns and work with our university collaboration program on state-of-the-art research topics interesting to Adobe and the academy.
Required Qualifications
Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field with research specialization in NLP, Machine Learning, or Computer Vision
Familiar with state-of-art deep learning frameworks, such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, Keras, Caffe, Torch.
Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java, and C/C++
Excellent communication skills and intense teamwork experiences
Preferred Qualifications
Strong publication record in NLP, Machine Learning, or Computer Vision
Experience in state-of-the-art NLP technologies (transformers, etc.)
Experience in multimodal machine learning (image+text, video+text, etc.)
Experience working with large-scale datasets
Track record of collaborating with researchers in adjacent domains such as Computer Vision, video, and document understanding
Experience in working with product teams on technology transfers

Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability.

PhD or MS degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Electrical Engineering, Operations Research, Econometrics, or other related fields.

Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a great teammate.

Title: Principal Financial Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Adobe Research is looking to hire a Senior Research Scientist in the broad area of Big Data and Systems Research. We are specifically looking for established researchers who can amplify our ongoing research in Scalable Systems and AI Ops in our research lab in San Jose. Responsibilities include working closely with researchers, engineers, user experience designers, and product managers to invent solutions to high impact systems problems, develop prototypes that showcase new research technologies, and to help integrate those technologies into Adobe’s products. Other meaningful responsibilities include keeping up to date with the latest research advances and integrating these into our platform. Our lab plays a key role in crafting next-generation applications and banner features in Adobe’s Creative, Document, and Experience Clouds.

Adobe Research blends ground breaking academic findings with industry impact. Our scientists are provided with the resources, support, and freedom to shape their ideas into innovative technologies and products. They collaborate with colleagues at over fifty universities, often communicating their work at leading international conferences. Many of our researchers’ discoveries are incorporated into Adobe’s products, building the company’s reputation as a pioneer in content and data intelligence. Our lab has an excellent track record of impactful product features and an excellent publication record with dozens of papers at world-class Computer Science conferences and journals. Some of our research topics include Real-time ML, Online Learning, Edge AI, Reinforcement Learning, Deep learning, Deep Reinforcement Learning, Representation Learning, Homeostatic & Self-Healing Systems, Systems for ML, Data Ingestion and Storage for Data Lakes, Video Editing and Delivery, Immersive Media, Causal Inference, and Counterfactual reasoning.

Adobe is one of the largest software companies in the world, and a market leader in three major areas: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and the Experience Cloud. Collectively, the three clouds process several trillions of interactions with content and transactions every year, involving hundreds of petabytes of data. This data offers researchers unparalleled opportunities for exploring web scale solutions for AI and ML.
What you’ll do
As a senior researcher, help drive the technical agenda in several critical areas, including developing the next generation of Systems for all Adobe Clouds, and solving challenges related to large scale data ingestion, system health, efficiency, redundancy, and cloud spend.
Responsible for providing technical leadership across multiple teams, by understanding the technical space deeply enough to help guide corporate and business strategy, or by providing innovations that fuel the growth of Adobe.
Be able to lead cross functional working groups or initiatives or provide consulting/advice to other departments or groups within the company.
Partner with the existing research teams at Adobe, including world class experts in AI/ML, computer vision, deep learning, NLP, graphics, and HCI.
Provide critical analysis of issues for continuous improvement of technology, process, and team productivity.
Act as an industry evangelist, internally and externally. Engage with the research community, including university faculty collaborations, intern recruiting and mentorship, and publishing and participation in premiere conferences. Help attract world class talent to Adobe.
What you need to succeed
PhD in Computer Science, EE, or an equivalent field and at least 3 years of experience in Systems Research
Prior experience working with product teams and delivering innovative research into products
Recognized by peers in industry, academia, or the research community
Recognized technical expertise includes but is not limited to publications, editorial and advisory boards, conference/symposium presentations, patents, professional peer recognition and strategically significant developments, innovations, or technical contributions
Demonstrated experience in mentoring and coaching interns, and junior technical contributors.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best employee with the experiences where everyone is respected. We realize that new insights can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The Opportunity
Our projects are pushing the boundaries of Document Intelligence. We are the team behind Acrobat Liquid Mode, which made Fortune’s Change the World list 2020 and has large scale user usage around the Globe.
As we continue to expand our portfolio of ML projects, we are increasingly investing in our Data Team. Our mission is to support all ML projects within Adobe Document Cloud by helping them acquire high-quality labeled data. We are looking for a Senior Manager to drive all our data efforts for machine learning projects. A successful candidate will be a key leader within the Document Cloud Artificial Intelligence group and partner with various ML teams across Adobe working on document intelligence. If this excites you, we'd love to hear from you! What You'll Do
You will lead a diverse team of taxonomists, software engineers, and machine learning engineers. You will be responsible for encouraging a Data-Centric AI climate in the org, and will collaborate with both internal ML teams and external data vendors to help ML teams plan and complete their data strategies. Our team focuses on 2 main areas:
Build a Data Platform to support the curation of high-quality document datasets throughout their lifecycle: acquisition of raw data, labeling, exploration, and assessment of fitness-to-task. We use active learning, weak supervision, and other techniques to optimize the labeling process while maintaining high standards for accuracy.
Advising and coaching various ML teams, helping them to craft a taxonomy for their project, to develop an appropriate annotation strategy, and to connect with the right vendor to generate high-quality labeled data.
You will lead a partnership with key stakeholders (engineering and product leadership) to help complete and evolve the strategy of the Data Team. You will grow the Data Platform, evolve processes, and develop strategic partnerships with leading Data-Centric AI companies to help optimize data for ML projects. What You Need to Succeed
Expertise in Data for ML projects
Understanding of ML techniques
Exceptional active listening and communication skills (written as well as verbal)
Ability to lead and plan projects in the face of ambiguity
Exceptional organization and people leadership skills – lead with compassion, high emotional and growth mindset
Experience in leading impactful and geographically distributed teams
5+ years of engineering management experience; 10+ years of total experience
BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent practical experience

You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our outstanding Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. Job_Description:
Our Company

About Cloud Operations
Adobe Cloud Operations supports a broad range of Adobe’s software product portfolio in the areas of design, delivery, and operation. We’re a distributed team of over 300 hard-working people who assist Development and Product Management teams to balance scope, quality, and time to market for our industry leading SaaS solutions.
About the Role
The Security Services team within Cloud Operations provides a suite of security tooling solutions that enable product development teams to get their work done. We embed security controls into our solutions so that our product teams can focus on improving features for Adobe’s global customer base. We are seeking a driven security DevOps engineer who can assist with our Secrets Management and Privileged Access Control teams. This position demands broad understanding and solid performance. Expected responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to:
Providing HashiCorp Vault services to the enterprise. Understanding Vault capabilities, use cases, and the accurate use of Vault within product deployment and runtime.
Understanding user access (human to machine) both on-premises and cloud resources.
Experience delivering highly secure and efficient solutions with comprehensive compliance frameworks including: FedRAMP, SOC2, ISO27001, HIPAA, PCI, and others.
Familiarity with observability, monitoring, and alerting systems including Splunk, Grafana, and PagerDuty.
Resolve system outages or performance impact and communicate findings for ongoing improvement.
Work with third-party vendors to recommend solutions and drive performance and cost efficiency.
Participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation
The successful candidate with have proven experience or capability in the following areas:
Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience
Deep experience with Linux, including large scale OS deployment and automation
3-5+ years of team lead or mentoring capabilities
Experience in public cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience operating secrets management tools (HashiCorp Vault, Azure Key Vault, AWS KMS)
Experience using orchestration, automation, and configuration management solutions (Jenkins/Terraform/SaltStack/Rundeck )
Experience with log analytics tooling (Splunk preferred))
Experience with programming or scripting (Python, Go, Bash, PowerShell)
Ability to recommend, design, build, and support complicated solutions at scale
Understanding of TCP/IP networking protocols and related technologies
Knowledge of software version control systems and release management (Git preferred)
Excellent written and verbal communication
About our Ideal Candidate
Passionate about designing and supporting complex IT systems while also being able to run day-to-day infrastructure operations. We want someone who does not prefer one tool, but rather looks for the right tool for the job
Mentorship experience and the desire to lead a team of engineers to the next level
Experience with FedRAMP environments and the ATO approval process
Analytical with the ability to fix complex system problems, to assess system performance problems, and can resolve situations looking for all the options and turning over every rock to find the best solution
Eager to learn, able to take guidance, and able to understand that there is always more to learn
Ability to work hard as a member of a small team that is asked to do a lot, while always remaining focused on customer success
Can manage time properly such that commitments are communicated and then met

Job_Description:
Our Company

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
This is an exciting opportunity to join the Digital Media Finance team as we continue to propel the business through data-driven forecasts and provide influential insights. In this role, you will have the opportunity to help drive Adobe’s pivotal initiatives by data engineering solutions that connect systems to visualization platforms for management reporting. The position will report to the Group Manager, Business Intelligence and Visualization to drive our systems and automation effort. This position will provide an outstanding opportunity to drive timely insights across Digital Media (DMe) Business at Adobe.
The ideal candidate for this role is a well-rounded top performer with excellent data engineering, analysis, and visualization skills, who will be a catalyst for growth in a fast-paced environment. You should be a strong partner, who enjoys forming cross-functional relationships within Adobe. You will support automating complex financial models, develop engaging and interactive dashboards, streamline processes, and drive efficiencies in management reporting. What you'll Do
Responsible for the strategy and execution of DMe lifecycle of financial and analytics dashboards and ensuring scalability of systems and processes
Manage data transitions and platform migrations between Hadoop/SAP HANA/Snowflake/DataBricks, Tableau/PowerBI, and related ETL processes
Develop data pipelines, connections, and infrastructure to better enable forecasting and data science modelling
Correct data errors via systematic, logical fixes and provide updates within the data pipelines, connections and infrastructures that are built to support the teams
Create documentation and support enablement for the teams who are interested and able to help themselves
Accountable for ad-hoc support & participation in critical business analytics and key project support as directed by management.
Partner closely with IT, Finance Systems, and Finance counterparts to continually improve, streamline & enhance planning and reporting processes. What you need to succeed
BS/BA with preferred focuses in areas of Business, Finance, or Information Systems. Master’s in Data Science a plus
5+ years of experience working with large and complex data structures and develop efficient queries to create calculated fields and data aggregates
3+ years of proven experience designing and developing dashboards using PowerBI
5+ years of relevant experience in data science and analytics in creating/maintaining financial models for a subscription/SaaS business a plus
Proficient in data platforms/systems (such as SQL, Hadoop, Snowflake, Databricks), ETL tools (such as Alteryx, SnapLogic), process automation, and standardization
Self-starter with high attention to details, excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to take charge, set objectives, and deliver results.
Strong project management skills with ability to juggle multiple priorities
Strong team orientation with great customer focus.
